But if there is one thing this installment teaches you, it's that no matter how far we advance in civilization with technology in the centuries to come, people will continue to behave asinine and take stupid actions when masked serial killers are on the loose. Let's just hope they can write better stories by then. I can only hope that Jason vs. Freddy is now the next agenda and that it will be worth the wait that this one couldn't promise.

I have seen all the Friday The 13th/Jason Films and just got done watching Jason X. I must say that in my opinion, this was a very action-packed installment with new elements introduced, adding a breath of fresh-air into the franchise. Kane Hodder, as always, is fantastic as Jason (He is to Jason Voorhees as Boris Karloff is to Frankenstein. Even though Hodder wasn't the original, he wears the character so well), and a supporting cast of new faces add to the excitement. Visuals are great and there is an excellent "fight" scene between sexy Android Kay-Em 14 (Lisa Ryder) and Mr. Jason, with edge-of-your-seat music to back it up. Harry Manfredini does a great music score for his 9th Jason film (he missed "Jason Takes Manhattan") and James Isaac does an excellent job as director. I don't know what movie the people who are bashing it saw, but I thought it was a great way of bringing Jason up-to-date to the 21st century.

I have missed good old Mr Voorhees over the past few years and i wasnt dissapointed with his return. This film, in my mind is one of the greatest to be released in a few years and is a very worthy addition to the series. the idea of setting it in the future was a good one and the new technologies used to blast Jason with are great. IF YOU DONT WANT ANYTHING SPOILED, PLEASE DONT READ ON. The idea of upgrading Jason, though slightly tacky, was a good idea to finish of the film with. The cyborg women was a bit too much like Lara Croft in the amount she defies the laws of physics for my taste but i'm sure i will get over it.

This may contain spoilers, but to be honest it's very difficult to spoil this god-awful film.Bride of Chucky was filmed with it's tongue firmly in it's cheek and I enjoyed that. This, however, is filmed with the utmost seriousness and suffers badly as a result.Jason becomes 'The Jasinator' at the end and gets blown out of a ship along with one of the good guys, who then appears to tackle 'The Jasinator' from a completely different angle. It looks absolutely ridiculous.The good scene I mentioned in my summary? Well it's the fantastic frozen head smash scene. If you've seen the film you'll remember it well :) For this alone I gave it 3 out of 10, otherwise it would have got 1.

While never a huge fan of the series, there have been occasional high points and plenty of low.But enough of previous efforts what we have here is popcorn fun.A unstoppable juggernaut of a serial killer hacking his way through space teens..  This does suffer as previous installments from fairly tame gore and minimal scares, but makes up with some great set pieces and a couple of great lines.Worth the price of admission alone for killer robo babe and Jason's disposal of a couple of nymphs on the holodeck.if you like these films your gonna love it, if not if probably isnt going to convert you.If you leave the brain at the door and go in expecting exactly what it says on the box, you'll probably be pleasently surprised

reviews.review_title: So what the hell did you expect...
reviews.content: I've read a few reviews of this so far, some not exactly flattering, and all I can say is, "What the hell did you expect?". If I was to grade this film based on all films ever made then I'd give it a 3. If I was to base it just on the horror genre then I'd make it a 5. But seeing how this IS a "Friday the Thirteenth" film...not exactly high art, then I'd give it a solid 8. For what it is, it is probable the second most entertaining in the series. I would rate six as best. That was the first one to take the approach that this is all kind of a joke...the same as myself. I don't buy into people who have been shot 100 times (or worse) getting up and walking around. At least not over the period of time that the Jasons and Mike Myers have survived. You would bleed to death. In 6 he becomes un-dead. Now he's believable unstoppable. The next three films where lacking in imagination. This didn't... the only thing it really REALLY lacked was a budget. With H20 money they could get a couple of LL Cool J's Or Jamie Lees and maybe polish those limited F/X. Then, just like Halloween, BOOM! a re-invented money cow. (did you see the numbers on H2O's box office? YIKES!!)This film is a lot more fun than that one..."Lets smoke a joint and have pre-marital sex...weeee!!!"
My opinion...this is the best in the series, it's the only one I actually liked...That's all!7/10

reviews.review_title: Jason kicks some butt in outer space...
reviews.content: The Friday 13th movies are something of a dichotomy. On the one hand, these movies are cheap trash with no more right to retain a place in movie history than Adolf Hitler has for winning a humanitarian award. On the other hand they are tremendous fun. I liken the 13th movies, and others of the ilk to the old Hammer movies; The endless chain of Frankenstien vs Werewolf meets Dracula, etc.There is no subtitle for the movie, but one could imagine it being "Jason goes to space"... but forget that, it should be "Jason gets a budget". I reckon they spent more on this movie than all the others put together.They certainly didn't spend it on a script, or acting. No change there then! They beefed up the special effects though and actually used some proper science-fiction concepts (such as nano-technology).So, with a budget chucked at it and some self-parody enclosed within it what can one say about it? The script was awful, the acting was cheesy, there was no tension or suspense or any chance of being scared. Yet, I had a good feeling deep down inside when I saw the revamped Jason. Good to see Kane Hodder playing Mr Vorhees again.So, overall, a reprehensible pile of trash that should be avoided at all costs.But Oh Lordy-lord, was it fun. :) I'm up for another sequel...

This is the best film ever made. The best film ever made used to be Jason Takes Manhattan, but now Jason is in space, which is crazier than Manhattan, so now Jason X is the best film ever made. Jason Takes Manhattan will have to settle for second place. Sorry, Jason Takes Manhattan.

This movie was a comedy for me, maybe i am too old to be scared anymore , but there was not a scary part in this flick, while the others were more suspenseful.  This movie made fun of itself and other scary movies with jason smiling with his eyes, and people making jokes while others get killed, and every girl in the movie is banging and wearing realy tight clothing.If you like a movie to be scary to not see this.  If you watch movies for strictly entertainment value and not for the "cinemetography" or acting or writing.  this is a good movie.This movie should be under comedy not horror when i go to rent it.

reviews.review_title: An O.T.T. Jason Vorhees scenario! (Spoiler ahead!)
reviews.content: This was a welcome return to the series. After the last 2 pieces of crap, I expected WAY worse than what I received. This was quite a refreshing return to the "Friday the 13th" series. Lots of CGI, alongside lots of murder, & bad dialogue the whole way through! There is a holo-deck scene that is hilarious, some sickening gore,lots of parts "borrowed" from "Aliens","Event Horizon","Saturn 3" & "The Matrix" The ending is SO over the top I was laughing for about 3 minutes. ANY fan of the "Friday the 13th" series MUST see this! Remember the curse of Crystal Lake!  I'll give it 5 out of 12!

Jason X has little to excite and stimulate anyone about.If you are a "die-hard" Friday the 13th fan,it will suffice.There's new ways of killing innocents that are quite intriguing and twice as brutal!But in the long run there are way too many blunders to mention in a thousand words or less. One day,maybe,when some horror-genre movie maker gets the idea to make a horror movie in space and in the future,they will at least CONSULT an expert of sci-fi flicks BEFORE making the finished product.

reviews.review_title: As Wayne & Garth would say, "You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll hurl"
reviews.content: As a pre-teen growing up in the 1980's, I was a big fan of the FT13 films. They used to frighten me and actually make me jump out of my seat.  As I grew older, I would watch them on cable or rent them whenever I was down for a little nostalgia.  I was 17 whenever JASON GOES TO HELL came out and it was the first FT13 film I saw in the theatre.  Needless to say, that movie sucked -- but, I've seen it several times since.  I first heard about JASON X about 2 years ago and was actually pretty excited about it.  It was supposed to come out over a year ago -- but, there was a lot of personnel problems over at NEW LINE and the release date kept getting pushed out. Finally, the movie had an official release date and the countdown began. I told my wife that we were "so there" on opening night and she just cringed with total anticipation.  You see, she was never into the FT13 movies and really had no interest in seeing it.  Well, needless to say, WE went to the movie on opening night and along with about 12 other people, walked away feeling like NEW LINE and everyone involved owed us back our money.  WHAT HAPPENED?  Where was that kick-ass movie that the trailer hinted at?  Now, some of you would say, "Well, by now, you should have known better", -- and you know what, you are probably right. When the movie first started, I was excited and I actually jumped out of my seat in one of the opening scenes. Then, somewhere along the way, JASON X became a cross between ALIENS, STAR TREK, and ERNEST GOES TO SPACE. In other words, EVIL GOT A COMEDY UPGRADE. For a minute, I though "NATIONAL LAMPOON" was behind it. If I had wanted to go see a comedy, I would have seen "VAN WILDER" again.  This movie didn't just stink, IT STANK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I was a good little geek and rented this DVD on its first day of release. I've seen all the other FRIDAY movies and although the series has bordered on self-parody for some time now at least JASON X took the concept someplace different (for once). JASON X was a goofy, mostly entertaining flick that liberally stole bits from dozens of other sci-fi/horror films. At least it was nowhere as bad as CRITTERS 4 and LEPRECHAUN 4, both of which also took their series stars into space. Here we have Jason cryogenically frozen in the near future, only to be re-animated in the year 2455 by a group of space-faring archaeologists/medical students aboard their ship, which of course causes the usual carnage. Some interesting kills (I especially liked Jason's creative use of liquid nitrogen!) but overall JASON X wasn't scary, it was more of a bloody action picture. Take Jason out of the scenes with the space marines stalking around dark corridors and replace him with an Alien and you'd have any of the ALIEN series. If you've seen the other nine (!) FRIDAY movies and have the same weird sense of duty that I do, feel free to pick up JASON X at your local video vendor, but those of you expecting a real scary movie are advised to look elsewhere. The DVD Bonus feature "The Many Lives Of Jason Voorhees" is worth a look too, in fact it's in many ways more entertaining than the actual movie. Now it's time to wait for Freddy Vs. Jason!

Well as a slasher flick, this movie works, as a story, the title works. But I don't think anyone would watch this movie for story anyway, so the majority of you are safe. It's not exactly original, but it stinks less than lepricon 4 (not that that's much of an accomplishment). Anyway, great for thrills, so you probably (at least before reading some idiot review by Ebert) like it.

It's hard to pick a worst in a series which has stood for all that is wrong with some horror movies. I will admit however, that I do get a small nihilistic thrill out of some of the entries in the series. When you don't wish to think or watch a good movie, they can be a somewhat pleasant diversion if you are predisposed to such things. That being said there are no thrills in this movie. It is a bad Alien rip off, but if you forget the killer is Jason it also feels like a Friday the 13th rip off. The acting is worse than usual, or maybe the bad acting is less forgivable due to the budget of the film. It's hard to say. The only decent(that might be too positive of word)thing about the film is the Crystal Lake holo sequence. It's a mildly clever poke at a serious that takes itself too seriously most of the time. The film makers thought that updating the story with "futuristic" touches would save the series, but honestly it might be a nail in the coffin that Freddy vs. Jason needed to pull back out. 1/5

This has got to be the worst film i have seen in a long time. Truly bad!!!!!!! Any horror fan (real horror fan) do not watch this it will hurt your eyes and you will realise you have just wasted nearly 2hrs of your precious time. It really does ruin the series of Friday the 13th. I really don't get what the director and writer were thinking when they thought this would be a good idea. If they have to make a horror film make your own up don't ruin a good series. i truly hope someone was fired or ridiculed for making this poor excuse of a film. awful,poo,worst film ever,shocking need i say more,,,,,,DO NOT WATCH THIS FILM

reviews.review_title: This is the worst movie ever made!!!
reviews.content: I'm not a fan of Friday the 13th., but a like just the first two parts, the other i think they're terrible. But seeing this movie was the worst thing i could possible do, Jason is now on space, if you believe that you could think this is a good movie, but after watch it you're gonna hate it. What was the writer of this movie thinking when he was writing it, is very awful, stupid, ridiculous, that ever the own Jason could possibly hate this movie.It's really the wost movie ever made, just for th fact of the story, and if this is a real horror movie, where lost. I really though it was the parody of the series, but i realize that it doesn't.1/10

When I first heard about the newest Jason movie taking place in space I rolled my eyes. First Leprechaun in Space and now Jason? I said to myself. But, when I saw the preview for Jason X, I was surprised at how good it looked. And well, I wasn't really disappointed.While, I'm not fond of most of the Jason movies (the only other one I really like is the one most people hate "Jason Takes Manhattan"), I did like this one.There was a lot of silly stuff in this movie, but that's the trend nowdays, to make horror movies "comedy-horror" or vice versa.The fight scene between Jason and Lisa Ryder(otherwise known as Bekka on Andromeda)'s character was absolutely awesome! Note that the other main female character was Lexa Doig(sp)who plays "Romi" on Andromeda.While not the best movie in the world, it was still quite entertaining. There were some things in the film I could have done without, but all in all, a pretty decent flick.*** 1/2 out of 4 *'s.

This film was quite enjoyable for the most part.  The initial action scene involving Jason an some local marine grunts (w. Cronenberg) really pumps the viewer up.  Jason is quicker and more realistic in this film, and Kane Hodder breathes life into the mass murderer in many subtle, yet effective ways (eg. mannerisms, eye contact, etc.).  The acting in the film was surprisingly strong for this type of film, but no one takes the subject matter too seriously.  Likewise, the special effects are used sparingly, but the sets are very atmospheric.  This episode has a budget of $14 million dollars, and I can safely say that the money was well spent.  The tone of the film is now a chase film, as opposed to a slasher film - and I believe this was necessary at this stage in the series because a rehash of the previous films would insult any self-respecting horror film fanatic's intelligence (I think?).  The comedy that is interspersed throughout the film is in fact 'not' annoying this time out.  I only have two concerns - (a) Now that the bar has been raised to such a high level (in Jason standards)- how do you top Jason X? (b) Now that Jason is 'Uber-Jason' - how do you continue that aspect of the character into the next sequels? (You need Kane Hodder of course - but what if you want to have Jason back in the sticks?)  In all - bravo, but too short a film (could have been 2 hours in length).

reviews.review_title: Intentionally The Best Comedy of the Year
reviews.content: I haven't laughed at a movie for so long in my entire life. The best part is that the people who made the movie knew it was bad and knew no matter how hard they tried, they weren't going to produce a scary script. So they went for the laughs and made it the best horror sequel ever.

Well you know somethin' Hulkamaniacs? I was prepared going into this movie for a disappointment, and for a while I thought I was gonna be proven wrong. "For a while" is the key phrase. At first, the movie annoyed me, with the remarks made about Jason, and how there's no explanation of the crossover from the last movie till now. The whole movie is great though most of the time, until we get to the robot part. I'm being vague to not spoil anything, but basically, once the robot-Jason takes form, the movie is officially done. It was totally a let-down and over-blow of a great story. The producers didn't know when to quit. Do what I should have done, before Jason becomes the robot, leave, and stay at piece with yourself, thinking that the movie ends there.

I'm not sure how films like this get greenlighted but whoever gave this one the thumbs up ought to be diced up by Jason himself.  I love a good slasher when I see it but this film fails to even deliver the ocassional cheap scare.  It seems to have been made as a campy installment to the classic series but the humor is so dull.  It had so many rip off scenes from other films, most notably Alien, that it seems no effort was put into it creatively.  No effort at all on any level.  Of course there were laughs but laughs at the films expense (what's with the costumes?)  I plead with those responsible for this film just, please, to let Jason die already and come up with a new super-villain.

reviews.review_title: The Best Movie of the series!
reviews.content: If you haven't seen Jason X yet, you have no idea what you are missing! It's a completely crazy horror flick that knows exactly what it is, a ridiculous attempt at bringing back a dead series.  Surprisingly, it works! The way that it makes fun of itself adds to the overall effect.  and the script itself was fabulous, the way they brought back old ideas was ingenious.  I can't recommend this movie enough.  Even if you hate horror movies, this is still the best popcorn movie to date, ever!

This film is indeed bad, but on the other hand, what do you expect from the series? It certainly matches up with the other 9 (yes 9). See it if you want to complete your cheesy horror collection.I'd make the effort to see the others first, as the plots get very complicated throughout the series (yes, this is sarcasm)

Oh my lord.  Jason X was quite possibly the worst movie I've ever seen (I'm not sure, I have to watch Battlefield Earth again)!  It was awful on every level imaginable.  Cinematography, special effects, acting, etc.  However, I will say that it was actually enjoyable because of how funny it was.  I honestly don't know whether they intended it to be funny (hopefully they did) because it couldn't have possibly been scary if it tried.

reviews.review_title: Hands down the worst in the series
reviews.content: I just saw the worst movie in a series that use to lead the pack over all other slasher film series.  Who in their right mind green lit this.  I can't find one good aspect about Jason X.  The special effects were subpar, the acting was horrible except for the gorgeous lead played by Lexa Doig.  Kane Hodder returns as Jason and he did his normal job as Voorhees.  The space marines honestly had the worst dialogue in the film and their weapons looked like something NERF sponsored.  I really hope New Line would just make the Freddy vs. Jason and have them both killed by Chucky or something.

reviews.review_title: A complete waste of money and time
reviews.content: This film was quite simply, a complete waste of my money and time. The acting was pathetic, the storyline was a joke, and some scenes were simply laughable they were so bad. The only good thing to comment on was the way most of the victims died, they were creative. Overall, I give this film 0 out of 10.

If you're going to the theatre expecting an Oscar winning film, then go see something else. If you're a horror fan looking for a fun movie to see with your friends, see Jason X. It's got the senseless violence and gruesome murders you'd expect from a Friday the 13th movie (and some inventive deaths I haven't witnessed before), and the tongue-in-cheek references to past movies in the series that will have you rolling in the aisles. Of course it's ridiculous - it's a movie about a unkillable serial killer - in space! What were you expecting? If you thought Scary Movie was funny, then you'll love this. Go, and have fun. And don't take it too seriously.

reviews.review_title: it ain't that bad, but ain't that great either!!
reviews.content: This film isn't the best, but isn't the worst storyline I've ever seen. take the characters for example, its true that none have been in a film prior to this shambles, however they are now part of the Friday the 13th saga, and that in itself is legendary. with the exception of Friday the 13th part four, the series has been on a downward slope since the third film which was diabolical!! worse than this film. the actors show that they aren't all that experinced, but jason makes up for it with stunning visuals and a scary new look. all in all this film is only worth watching if you don't care about missing out on the next hour and a half of your life, however is good for a laugh, and if you like the Friday the 13th series then you should enjoy this one, even if it is only for the laughs. check it out for yourselves, with new gory ways to die, very updated, but perhaps to much.

Just got round to watching Jason X more out of curiosity than anything else. Unfortunately i realised after approximately 40 minutes that i would have been better off repeatedly poking myself in the eye with a sharp stick.The dialogue was attrocious and the plot bloody awful, it tries to blend elements of Alien and Aliens but fails miserably.  The only saving grace was in the sfx department, but sadly some of those were cringe-worthy (the holo-crystal lake affair with the 2 girls harping on about loving pre-marital sex raised a brief smile).All in all a waste of good money that could have been spent making realistic Sunny Delight ads.Did anyone else think that Uber Jason looked liked a baddie from the Power Rangers ?

Wow!  I couldn't believe that they continue making sequels for this worn out movie.  The young actors in this film should have considered taking a pass on this garbage, because it can't be called anything better.  You should definitely go out and see any alternative possible to this monstrosity.

I liked this movie.  Hardcore Jason fans may be disappointed, but I liked it.  This movie was a mix of sci-fi, urban horror, and comedy.  From the events you could see coming from a mile away that still managed to make you laugh, to the stupid one-liners the characters threw out at certain crucial intervals.  This movie did not disappoint me.  If you want to see an epic story of good versus evil, or a dramatic adventure into a character's life... this is not the movie for you.  But if you want some violence, some laughs, and most importantly, to see our masked killer Jason stalking people relentlessly, this movie is for you.

Jason X - a great movie...definitely of expected caliber, plus some!Think of the previous movies in the series - it's definitely up to par! Even if you don't know how the rest of the series is this movie pretty much sums it up and adds quality where it was needed.This movie includes the action expected. There's lots of death and murder, but with a futuristic touch.I recommend this movie to those who enjoy those qualities that I've previously stated, and just the right amount of comedy :)Of course there are those unrealistic aspects that are present in all of this series - but it's to be expected, that's how this series works!It's what you would expect from this particular series - mixed in with a bit of Alien. Go out and see it! It's definitely worth the money, if for nothing else than to enjoy the comical futuristic touch that separates it so much from the rest of the series :)

reviews.review_title: one of the worst movies i've seen
reviews.content: when i was going to see this movie with my friend we thought it might be kind of corny with jason being "upgraded" and all,but it was worse than we imagined! first of all,there were way too many sexual scenes for this type of movie!!! everyone aboard the space station was supposed to be doing an actual job which in reality all they were doing were running off to rooms and getting it on!!! oh yeah and i especially love the part where the girl goes in the room to get "tutored" by her professor!! haha..what a joke!! and the ending was so typical too!!not to mention how stupid it looked! when jason was flying through the air  he looked like superman!!! this movie definitely had no real plot and i'd give it a 2 on a scale from 1-10 just for the virtual scene with the camp girls at the end cuz i laughed my butt off!!

Other than the fact that the cyborg chick was the coolest in the movie, I have to say that SO many times I was cheering for Jason!  While the characters were one dimensional, isnt that what its all about? murder murder murder!  It could have been a little shorter, but there were some classic scenes.  The best is where he puts the girl's (whos much to hot to be a scientist type) face in the liquid nitrogen and then smashes it. classic.

reviews.review_title: This is why we don't make sequels that take place in space.
reviews.content: This was my first Jason movie. It was cool when I first saw it but then was just stupid. they were going to do this with Halloween also but they didn't. The only reason this movie gets away with anything is because they were trying to make Freddy vs Jason and ran into some problems so they made this movie for the wait. When Uber Jason comes out you know this movie just got a lot worse. So how did the government get a hold of him? I doubt they just walked up to him, read him his rights put him in handcuffs then threw him in the back of a FBI van. It's like a Jason version of Alien: Resurrection. The robot vs Jason went to far and was just ridiculous. It has some parts where even Jason would be smart to know that a location is fake. Such as the Crystal Lake Simulation. When You have metal walls instead of rocks doesn't that strike you as odd? It was one of those films where its so bad you like it.

reviews.review_title: Not Ashamed To Admit I Liked This Film
reviews.content: A big fan of the slasher genre, I was very excited when I heard Jason was coming back to the big screen.  Then when I heard the plot--Jason in Space, I was deflated.  WHAT? I thought.  NO WAY!  Then it kept getting delayed, and that peeked my interest.  By the time it came out, I was dying to see it.  I went into that theater and had A BLAST!  It wasn't Shakespear or Oscar material, but it was one helluva good time.  I had so much fun, it was like seeing an old friend again.  It wasn't the same as the series hayday when a new Friday film came out almost every year, but it was close enough, and just different enough to hold my interest.  I ran out and bought the DVD as soon as it came out.

reviews.review_title: run away as it has HIV on it!!!
reviews.content: I respect the Friday the 13th legend. Which I believe could have become a greater legend if left on its own. But as long as box office dollars are on the agenda, we will see far too many disasters as this one.For the movie, the undying Jason has been frozen in order to save mankind. But after a few centuries, accidentally a space ship finds the ship that Jason is inside, and again accidentally awakes him. Jason once again does what he does best and slicing everyone on the ship. Besides all the technology the humans have, this ship has only have automatic rifles even older than the US army now using.The worst moment was when the cyborg was modified, she kills Jason. But what the heck, all those frozen years has given Jason the ability to modify himself with any electrical cable that is not isolated. It was such a disaster.Bad movie, poor acting, low budget and a horrible series of bad ideas. Not to mention the lousy digital effects.Run away as it has HIV on it and you have an open scar..regards..

This just might be the worst movie I've ever seen. The whole thing is just so ridiculous. Nothing is at all realistic, the lines are cheesy, the acting is bad, Uber Jason????? What? I want to know who the editor was that looked at the final version of this movie and said "This looks good, I think we're finished." If I ever meet him, I'll slap him.The plot is terrible. Absolutely terrible. A bunch of people on a spaceship in the future find a frozen man with a machete. They now have some technology that re-animates frozen people. The captain of the ship talks to his "boss", who tells him to bring Jason back and make money off him. The captain knows that it is Jason Vorhees, but wakes him up anyway. A series of badly choreogrpahed slashings ensue and....well, you get the point.When I saw this movie, I laughed the whole way through. Not at their unfunny jokes, but at the fact that someone could make a movie so bad, and still take themselves seriously. I only suggest watching this movie if your cable is out and the only movie in your house is Jason X, and you are in the mood to laugh at someone. But seriously, I'm surprised that the filmmakers could sit through this and say "Wow, this is turning out well."

reviews.review_title: Jason in space. How did this happen???
reviews.content: While waiting for production of Freddy vs Jason the Friday producers decided to make a new film and do something different with it. Great idea, but what possessed them to put Jason in outer space? A move like this makes the franchise look desperate for new life and it looks embarrassing when you compare it to the early films which were well done suspenseful horror films. Now the idea of mixing Jason with science fiction could have worked with the beginning of the film having Jason captured and examined to see what makes him keep regenerating. Mix that with an X-files type feel and it could have been interesting. With that said, I can see how this film can be a guilty pleasure and it does have its' campy entertainment value. Still a move like this really makes the franchise look weak and tired.

reviews.review_title: Screamingly funny, but throw away every logical thought!
reviews.content: Contains spoiler I have to say, that I only saw parts 1 and 2 of this series and didn't like them very much. So my expectations were quite low! Of course, I also didn't expect an original story or really good actors. But I failed! With a Bodycount higher than most other Horror-Movies Jason works his way back on screen into an era of hightech- and just-for-fun-murderers. So this movie comes very self-ironic and funny, not just because the kills are very original, but also because of the unusual location and atmosphere. For an example: Jason throws a soldier onto some pile, nothing new. But after a few seconds, the corpse starts to turn on the pile and the pile appears as a screw were the corpse is now screwed... (I hope I was able to explain it quite well, in spite of my weak english...) So, I had a lot of fun, and if voting would already be accessible, I would give this movie a 7, just for all this fun and those really, really, really cool murder scenes! Go and watch it!

So, just seen Jason X. Just to say it in the beginning, I think Friday, 13th, Part III is still best of this series I've seen this far. I haven't seen all movies, though. I also think it's good they dropped the "Friday" in the title. It's all about Jason since part II anyway. If you want to know why slasher movies are barely made anymore, watch this movie: It's as mindless as it can get. Jason's there. He's invincible. He's murdering. No reason given for anything. He's just doing it. Don't wonder about anything, they won't explain it. Don't think the plot makes sense. Don't even expect a working story. It's all not important. The only thing you can hope for in slasher movies are cool, different locations, some brief nudity and different ways of killing people. And in this aspect, Jason X rocks. High budget. Cool sets. Cool special effects. Tons of gore and Jason slashes his evil heart out to the extreme with some very cool death scenes. I mean, freezing the head of a person, and then smashing this frozen head to pieces? Geez, who's getting such ideas. The thing Jason's doing with the sleeping bags gets a clever reprise. As far as I know, he did this in another part.
*minor spoilers*Also, Jason's not killing helpless civilians (students, read teenagers) only, but also has to deal with highly trained soldiers and a harmless bot, which got upgraded to a mean fighting machine ("'fraid I'm gonna have to hurt you now."). By the way, I absolutely love this bot. Witty remarks and an actress who obviously enjoyed her play. If you absolutely hate this movie, at least fast forward to the fight Jason vs. bot. It's the best scene of the movie. The end of the movie manages it in a believable way to get back on "earth". You even hear the typical "Friday, 13th" music... doors for the next part are open wide.Jason X is stealing from a lot of movies. Critters IV comes to mind, which is also based in a space-ship in the future. Also I think of Aliens (highly equipped soldiers dying, and a civilian yelling "Get them out of there!"), Aliens IV (existing monster gets reborn into an "uber monster") and Matrix (costume design of soldiers/bot, character gets martial arts training uploaded). The story is extremely stupid, and I think just watching this movie my IQ lowered some points, but it was fun to watch... and this is the most important thing, isn't it? For a normal movie I'd give it a 3/10, but rated as slasher movie it deserves a 8/10.

Having seen all the Friday the 13th movies and being a big fan, I was eagarly anticipating another sequel after waiting 9 long years. But after being disappointed with Jason Goes To Hell, I was hoping for more.
You have a very mixed bag here. First off, I have to say I'm not a huge fan of the whole space-ship sci-fi motif so the movie loses points on my scale immediately. Secondly, the year 2455 ? Come on, that's a lil too far in the future don't you think ? Thirdly, the characters seem really dumb for such sophisticated people. Not knowing what a hockey mask or a bike was made me want them dead in a hurry myself.Surprisingly though, the first hour or so, was pretty interesting  to say the least. Jason was going about his regular non-essential character killing spree before things, in my opinion, go horrifically wrong. The whole sequence where the robot/android "kills" him is simply retarded. It seemed more like a Lara Croft:Tomb Raider rip off more than anything else. But I suppose they need this to happen in order to create this "Cyber-Jason". While I'll admit he does look kinda cool (although I think the original Jason looks better), he just comes back like this WAAY too late in the movie to give this transformation credibility.I may not speak for everyone with this review, and of course people have the right to their own opinion but I prefered the old school friday the 13th films over this one. But hopefully they come back to that old time forest rampage action with the next film, which seems enivitable with the final sequence involving the mask floating in the water.With that being said, New fans to the series may like this one, and perhaps old school fans will too depending on whether you've lost faith in the series altogether or not. It's not a terrible movie by any means, it just got lost along the way!

reviews.review_title: This movie was not that bad...
reviews.content: I expected to see a cheezy, bad movie where you're supposed to be scared but nothing is ever scary (ie, blair witch project).  However, Jason X is not that bad of a movie.  It was mostly a comedy movie, with lots of gore (ie dead alive).  And to tell you the truth, I was pleasantly surprised.There are some things in the movie that are really predictable (just as you'd think) but there're some good parts too.  If you see this movie thinking it's going to be horrible, as I did, you'll walk out of the theatre with a smile.

Let me start by saying I don't like horror movies. I think they are trite gorefests whose only appeal is seeing people die in disgusting ways. A friend talked me into going to see Jason X, and I went to the matinee. Jason X was everything one expects from a slasher film- blood and guts, bad acting, cheesy music- but it was by far funnier than any slasher film I've seen. It never takes itself seriously, and that is the beauty of it. The characters don't seem to care that they are about to be killed as long as they can say some sarcastic remark before they get axed. Some of the deaths were inventive and a scene with two crystal lake camp counselors is the funniest thing I've seen at the movies all year. Don't see this movie if you are looking for award winning cinema, but I would recommend this for people looking for an entertaining movie.

I just saw the unrated and uncut version of this movie in a large cinema with over 1000 seats filled mostly with Jason fans, and I must say that this movie rocks. It has everything you would expect from a Friday the 13th movie... and more. Plenty of gore scenes, some funny and selfironic stuff, a lot of allusions to the other jason movies, many sexy dressed chicks and a really evil Jason on a killing spree. This is definitely one of the best Jason movies. When I first heard about this movie, I had my doubts about the futuristic theme, but it suits the movie very well (unlike Hellraiser IV) and adds some fresh ideas to the Friday the 13th series. Even the Terminator/Robocop like Jason at the end of the movie fits in well. If you're a fan of this genre, go watch it in a theater as soon as you can and definitely buy the DVD (but only if they release this uncut version)!

I just saw the movie, and I have to admit I was expecting to have wasted an afternoon.  This movie is very exciting, good special effects, and funny as hell.  See the movie, it is the most entertainment I've had from cinema in a while. =)

I saw the trailer.  The first thought that came to my mind was critters, alien resurrection and a few other... "Take it to Space" thrillers.  Most movies of this nature aren't really all that great.  It is the same story... "Get trapped in space, must fight to survive."This movie followed that, but the bad ass characters that normally make it through the movie died really fast in the beginning of the movie, leaving the weak to fend for themselves.  Again, Jason kills and can't be killed as in all the Friday the 13th movie.I watched the movie and to say the least, I enjoyed it.  It wasn't scary, but it kept in line with some classic themes and this time Jason took no prisoner and really showed how intelligent he was considering "He has such a small brain."  If you watch the movie, you'll get the "brain" part.Go and see it, it is worth the view.

reviews.review_title: Why do people watch crap like this?
reviews.content: This came on TV a few nights ago and, not surprisingly, was painfully bad on just about every level. What bugs me is that they keep making crap like this because people keep watching it. I read some review on Rotten Tomatoes in which the critic, probably some guy living in his parent's basement, argued that critics would pan this film just because it's a slasher film. I think it's quite the opposite. I think slasher fans will love any piece of crap no matter how terrible it is. There are well made Slasher films. The original Friday The Thirteenth, the original Halloween, the original Nightmare on Elmstree, Scream, and many more. These weren't masterpieces of American cinema but they at least managed to be creepy and entertaining. Not the case with this. It's terribly shot, terribly acted, and, worst of all, not the least bit scary. There's never any tension in the film. Most of the deaths are quick and silly with little to no suspense or build up. Any build up that is there simply amounts to us looking at Jason standing stationary as he waits to kill someone. Why is it that horror fans can't distiguish a good slasher film from a bad one? Why do they let studios get away with crap like this? And I grow tired of the "it's tongue-in-cheek" defense. Pulling off tongue-in-cheek requires writing that's witty and amusing. Not hoping that because you're dialogue, acting, and directing is so bad that people will laugh awkwardly. I can get that boy showing home videos of kids learning to potty-train and it sure as hell wouldn't cost me 13 million dollars.

This film really surprised me in a good way! I mean, okay, the story is pretty dull (Jason is now in space and becomes a half-robot), but - Friday the 13th movies have never been something for the intelligent among us, have they? In fact, Jason X is much better than the most of its predecessors. The actors aren't really good - but, on the other hand, they're a way better than the actors from, say, "Friday the 13th 4". The effects are really cool, especially the splatter effects (at best on the Europian DVD (NC-17 rating!). But the best thing about this film is the humor: There are lots of references to the earlier FT13th films (just watch the Virtual Reality scene near the end - hilarious!) and some funny dialogues. All in all, much more worth watching it than the most of us horror fans have expected.

Well this movie was pretty much a waste of time, although there was one funny part where Jason beat the hell out of two naked girls, i laughed at that, the only reason to watch this movie is for Lexa Doig, she is by far one of the hottest actresses out there, although she's not naked or anything in this movie, its still worth it to see her altogether.

reviews.review_title: Not As Bad As One Might Think!
reviews.content: I'll be honest, when I first heard the concept behind Jason X, I was as scared as a 20 year old, naked woman at Camp Crystal Lake.  Jason on a spaceship in the future?  That's just crazy talk.  But you know what, it's not half bad.  Granted, they have completely left what made parts 1-4 good behind but as the tenth in the series they could have done much worse.(Remember the heart eating scene in Jason Goes To Hell?)  Sure this one is full of bad one liners and is as unoriginal as as the previous four, but as far as entertainment value goes, it's definatly worth a look.  At least if your a fan of the series.(If this will be your first Friday film, don't bother!) I don't want to ruin anything but if you've made it through the first nine and still call yourself a fan, check it out.  Just don't be to hard on it.  What else can you do with a mentally handicapped. homicidal madman in a hockey mask?  At least they tried.  Come on New Line, get on the ball with Freddy VS. Jason!!!!!!!

I'm not really a Jason fan, but this movie was good.  It's good because the movie is not afraid to laugh at its self.  Among the horror and action scenes are the jokes throughout the movie.  Frankly I went in expecting a real stink-burger, but the movie turned out being fun for the very reason that a serious horror movie would never work in space and the writer and director knew this.  So if you want to have a good time this spring, hop on the fun boat goin' full steam ahead with Jason Voorhees as captain.

reviews.review_title: NO JOKE, GOOD CONTENDER FOR WORST MOVIE EVER
reviews.content: I did not go see this movie with the highest expectations. Being a fan of the friday the 13th series, it interested me when i first heard that a new jason movie was coming out. First i heard it was freddy vs. jason, then finally i heard it was just another sequel. Well lo and behold, this movie screams of low-budget cheese factory. It was horrendously bad. The story is so awful, its hilarious. Its basically this-having finally caught and imprisoned jason, a female scientist tries to find ways to execute him(she says theyve tried everything from gas chamber to firing squad and he won't die)and finally gives up, so instead they will cryogenically freeze him forever. Then one of the head scientists decide they will keep him alive so they can study him. He laughably explains that jason has an amazing ability to heal, hence the difficulty of people trying to kill him. Anyway, he escapes being fully chained, then gets frozen, then defrosts and lives again only to keep killing everyone on sight for no reason. An absolute must see.

Hollywood sucks. There are many unemployed screenwriters out there with good ideas. Sure, some are bad, but hey, how much worse could those be then that movie. They can't come up with anything new these days. Comic book character movies, damn a.. remakes, or freaking sequels. How can they waste 14 Mill on such a bad script? Didn't they read it before deciding on making a movie out of it? And who finances such bull? They must be proud on their return of money. But I guess they lost anyhow, at least I hope so. No plot, not scary, not even a slasher. You can guess that I did not like that piece of crap at all (1 of 10). Waste of time, money, talent if any, and space in the theaters. I am happy I just recorded it from TV and did not spend anything but lost time on it. Right up there with Battlefield Earth. Lets see how they throw away more money on Freddy vs. Jason (not seen yet), and Alien vs. Predator.

reviews.review_title: One of the better chapters in the Friday the 13th series
reviews.content: I am a huge fan of the Jason films and i must say that Next to Parts 7, 3, and 9 this is one of the better ones. First of all we actually get to see Jason away from the lake again (In part 8 he goes on a cruise ship and then ends up in New York City in the end) Kane Hodder who plays a great role as Jason Voorhees for the forth time is outstanding in this one. The body count is 28 and Jason kills people in some very intresting ways. The only thing i can say that was bad about this film is there was way too much humor. Horror films should not have humor cause there suspose to be serious and frightening. I give this friday a 8 out of 10 cause it was really awesome and of corse im a Jason fan. Can't wait untill Freddy vs. Jason witch actually atkes place before this one.

reviews.review_title: Not For The Faint Of Heart
reviews.content: Jason X was almost exactly what I expected. A serial killer maniac who refuses to die and takes out his vengeance out upon unsuspecting teenagers. I thought with futuristic weapons and all that taking out Jason would actually occur, but then I thought about the title "evil gets an upgrade". Having read a few spoilers before viewing the film, I knew he would turn into a semi-robot sort of cy-borg freak. I knew he would be powerful beyond belief. My one question was then, how can he possibly be stopped? Will he be stopped? My second answer came at the end of the movie. WE TRULY DO NOT KNOW. If you are a fan of the series, you will enjoy, others should stay away. Okay special effects and some more interesting kills made this one an easier one watch than some of the others. After seeing this, I believe there will be a Friday the 13th part XI, but judging from the way they like to number things, it may just be called JASON X part two. I give it a 7/10

OK - I know it was a horror movie, and on that end, it failed. It was also a comedy, and on that note, it was hilarious. If you can deal with the obvious mindless nonsense, and awful acting, go see it. It's so funny, you'll have tears in your eyes!!!

Jason X was one of the funniest movies that I've seen in a long time. Highlight scene was Jason and 2 girls in the woods where he was swinging one of them around while she was in the bag.  Ridiculous.Another highlight was when Jason gets his legs and arms blown off and he squrims around and still tries to kill everyone.  Then he turns into a robo jason and the movie gets messed up from there on out.Also, Jason looks like superman flying around in outer space.  The special effects: not so special.  So fake that it makes you laugh.Nothing clever about this movie, just a bunch of killing and stupid one liners and a sex robot and the movie is overall, very funny, get up and go see it.  One of the very few horror movies that I recommend. Later.

reviews.review_title: This is the shot in the arm the series has needed!!
reviews.content: If you're thought that you had seen the last of Jason, you were wrong. This movie went ABOVE AND BEYOND what I was expecting. And with the ending(no spoilers!), you just KNOW New Line is going to have to make another one. If you love the Friday the 13th series, get out and support this latest installment. You WON'T be disappointed!

reviews.review_title: THE FUNNIEST MOVIE OF THE YEAR
reviews.content: This is a must see for all Jason fans.  You will see horror, comedy, hot girls naked and great cheesy lines that will have you falling out of your seat. Quality special effects with great new ways to kill people.  Old plot takes a new twist in the future.  We can't wait for the next one.

When I went to see Jason X I expected to see almost all the same things I see in the regular horror movies but the way all our technology made the movie has busted through the barrier of sci-fi thrillers.  And the phrase Evil Gets an upgrade did suit the movie exactly.  Jason is one of the best serial killer with the best record of murders (191 people at the end of Jason goes to hell).  The Director and Producers have out done themselves and if you are a horror fan get of you butt and go see this movie if you have not yet seen it.  It is non stop thrills, chills, and plenty of suspense.

Jason X isn't a very bad sequel to the normal Friday the 13th sequels. Jason X takes place in 2455, earth is ruined and a group of archaelogist students, along with some soldiers and a teacher, take a trip to the ruined earth.  That's when they come across two frozen bodies. One, a VERY hot girl. The other, some freaky guy wearing a hockey mask and wielding a machete.  That's when the plot holes start to kick in. the first one, it is not very smart to thaw out a tall freak who is wearing a hockey mask and has a machete in his hand.  Now what kind of idiots thaw out a person like that? Our doomed students are.  So they unthaw the two bodies out and the first one is the hot girl.  She tells them not to unthaw the other one because it is the infamous Jason Voorhees.  But they're a little too late for that. Jason is already on the loose and might I add is VERY p**sed off.  Then comes the screaming and running and dying.Most of the characters in this flick are pretty cool, like the sexually curious android and the tough Sergeant who just won't die.  The fights between Jason and Kay-Em 14(the android) is very entertaining, along with the fight between Jason and Sergeant Broadski.  Most of this movie isn't as bad as critics say.  Jason gets to revisit Camp Crystal Lake circa 1980. He gets to entertain two pre-marital loving campers, and even redoes a classic death in Friday the 13th part 7 (I won't give it away.)  Overall this movie is good yet can live without the plot holes (So they just remember at the end they have an escape pod.) Rating 6 out of 10.

This is the worst jason movie ever made!  Jason's mask isn't even close to any of the other ones and the story is so lame.  One major reason this movie was so bad was the fact that they take Jason out of camp crystal lake and put him in space..HELLO.....Jason belongs in the woods, not on the star ship enterprise. Doing this is like taking a fish out of water. While I am on the subject of Jason  Friday the 13th   part 1 to part 6 are the only ones that exsist  everything after that is a joke!!

As far as im concerned.... Roger Ebert doesnt care about any movie that doesnt have love in it, or isnt a chick flick... so his opinion on anything means squat - so listen to someone who knows=)yeah, 10 movies in a slasher series is a bit much.. and this is hands down the worst of the series.. (which is saying a lot.. since they did make VIII - Jason Takes Manhattan) .. This one, much like VIII .. has *NOTHING* to do with the storyline, other than stab, hack, slash kill...  Highlights: few Really cool kill scenes... couple laughs. Downfalls: its in space, Jason Turns into some uber-elite space geeked out metal-freak (which really.. ruined the movie) .. overall. rent it when every other decent movie is out of stock @ the video store..

I went to this movie with little expectations, and I believe that's the best way to see it. Don't bring your brains 'cause you won't be needing them. I only had seen the first of the Friday the 13th movies, a movie that I liked a lot, the 80s were the best decade for slasher movies.As a slasher movie, the way it was intended to be, Jason X totally sucks, but actually this movie was so bad, that I liked it. The one-liners are very silly and unfunny, but in a way that they become funny again like for example SPOILER when Jason throws one of the soldiers on a screw, another soldiers reports that his friend is screwed END SPOILER.Of course this isn't oscar material, but if you look at it as a comedy, you might find it entertaining.

How can a film like this be made! Someone must have written this script and thought it was good, for the sake of everyone don't let this person write another one. When I saw this I walked out the cinema doors and wanted my money back, and a little bit extra for just watching it until the end. The Friday the 13th series gradually went down hill, i liked the first and second, the others were good enough to watch...this one was a joke.
It was funny in parts but only becuse it was so corny.
Anyone that liked the Friday the 13th series shouldn't even utter the words Jason X.One of the worst films ever.

How can I give this movie a 10 and still say it's stupid? Easy; what would you expect of a movie franchise like this to be? All along we have Jason surviving bullets and knives and being electrocuted by some means, but there was never any suggestion that his "powers" were alien in nature(like "Jason Goes to Hell suggests). Not that electricity would bring him back to life after his body was decayed for awhile(like "Friday the 13th, Part VI: Jason Lives" suggested). All of these horror movies can easily have had better plots. Why don't the writers see to it that they do? Because people like me will continue to see such movies simply because it deals with Jason, Freddy, Michael Myers, etc. Since these movies are meant to be ridiculous and silly and incoherent, then I must say that the producer and director have reached their goal. Bravo! Reaching one's goal is what it's all about, so any rating less than a 10 would be unjust.

reviews.review_title: Not as corny as the others
reviews.content: Ok, Of course this movie wasn't gonna be great- any real fan of the series would know that. I just wonder why some people rate the acting in movies like these when they know, THEY'RE NOT SUPPOSED TO ACT, THEY ARE THERE TO DIE!... But to cover up the goofy futuristic storyline- they fill it with death, some interesting ways to death, and there was alot of death too... I like the movie cuz it gave me what i wanted to see, Jason killing people... if the actors made corny lines, so what!. they got what they deserved.

This movie is exactly what I had hoped for and what should have been made. I heard and read many reviews stating that this movie is ill-conceived and edited poorly, etc. IT'S A FRIDAY THE 13th MOVIE FOR CHISSAKES!!! It's supposed to be all of that. I would have been dissapointed with anything more cerebrial and better made. I think that the execs at New Line knew what they were doing when they bought the script and hired Issacs to direct. Sure they could have sunk a few million more into the picture and made a "better movie" but that would not have been in the spirit of the franchise. They further realize that Freddy and the  "Nightmare" series is the darker and less campy horror franchise and that the "Friday" movies are FUN. Kudos to all involved...watch this movie and enjoy it for what it is.

I can't believe that some people actually enjoyed this movie, I mean, it's the biggest load of crap I have ever seen in my entire life, and I have seen my share of horrible horror movies.When I first watched "Jason goes to hell", I thought to myself: if I ignore that it's part of the Friday the 13th saga, this movie isn't so bad, it's stupid yes, but it can kind of be entertaining.Now, as far as Jason X is concerned, you can pretend that it's a completely new idea, with a completely new serial killer and it still it's preposterous.The simple notion of having Jason go to space is ridiculous, I mean really, how many of us think of the space as scary? Granted, alien was an awesome movie, but it was a horror movie with a creature FROM space, not a serial killer that hides in the woods and used to chop off teenagers that smoked pot and had 'round the clock sex (good old times, sigh) that's suddenly shipped off to space.As for the contents of the movie, the acting is totally lame, (it kind of looks like some bad TV movie acting), the sets are incredibly badly built, and what the hell was that? Uber Jason? When I saw that I couldn't believe my eyes..Jason is freakin' terminator now? Fighting a robot chick (or whatever)? The doctor who got frozen with him was the worst female lead in a horror movie of all time, the rest of the remaining characters, god, i just wanted to dress myself as Jason and kill them all myself. they were so annoying, you just want to watch them die. And if the whole freaking world knows how dangerous Jason Vorhees is, WHY IN HELL WOULD SOMEOME WANT TO KEEP HIM ALIVE? Because he's a god damned zombie? Come on, get real..This movie just seems to be a stern of ludicrous ideas and an attempt to revitalize the Friday the 13th saga, which, imo, killed it instead. I am a huge Friday the 13th fan, but this movie is really horrible.I don't advise anyone to waste their time in this piece of crap, unless you want to rip out your eyeballs so you don't have to watch (which I almost did).Seriously, don't waste your time with this one, just not worth it, at all.

This movie sucked because Jason in space is retarded. it was OK until the guy who got split in half was still alive,not to mention Jason with armor. the movie would have been better if Jason was restored with his normal form. even though this movie sucked i give it 3/10 because i don't know. i believe that Jason v Freddy was OK,i actually went to see it in theaters, usually i don't do that but i was bored and had nothing to do. i was rooting for Jason because i think killing people in there dreams just makes that person a pu**y. Jason has balls to go up to a dumb big breasted blonde who runs like a snail and trips over her own feet and slice her in half. thats cool.Jason does get boring because the killings are mostly all the same.

Even worse than JGTH to be honest. The acting is at an all time low, as is the dialogue, cinematography, story, music,everything. Uber Jason? Ugh. The attempts at comedy were juvenile and forced. Over the years I've tried so hard to give this film some type of credit, but it's just absolutely awful. The best thing about this film is the liquid nitrogen kill, but that's it. Uber Jason was a stupid idea...these types of ideas are what kills franchises.It just pisses me off. To me, this movie was even worse than Jason Goes To Hell. The death scenes were terrible except for those two that I mentioned earlier. The kill number of this movie is 24, but 2 are accidents and 2 are suicide type things so really, Jason only killed 20. So it's a relatively higher number than any of the other movies except for Freddy Vs. Jason and Jason Goes to Hell, which technically wasn't even JASON the whole movie.Serial killers don't believe in space!

I watched this movie for kicks, I didn't expect much, and it didn't deliver. For those of you who don't know the plot yet, Jason is cryogenically frozen and thawed in the future where he starts killing people on a space ship.
Okay, this was the worst Friday I've seen yet (though, I haven't seen all of them, only 1 - 4 and this one). Jason is a large, brutish machine that never seems to die, and is some sort of supernatrual boogie man that is indestructible (at least earlier one, he could be stunned long enough for a chase scene). It's campy, and tries to be a comedy, but doesn't hold up well.It's zany, it's crazy and I never laughed so hard as the sleeping bag scene, but all and all, I only ever saw it once, and I'm never gonna watch it again.1 out of 10 stars.

reviews.review_title: Another case of let it die.
reviews.content: This movie is just another case of the "Give up and let it die." I mean come on, hes been stabbed, shot, decapitated, blown up, crushed, mangled, hit by cars...They just couldnt stop could they, no they had to drag it all the way to 10, and i am a fan of the first couple Friday the 13ths', but this one....I mean, Oh HO! hes been upgraded! Give me a break! Upgraded to suck. If it werent for the wannabe suspenseful music, the overused, crappy overall plot, bad acting, and bad humor, etc. Id say this was a crap movie.

This movie is about as terrible, as any low- or high-budget blockbuster of nowadays. I don't want to spread about it any longer, but I have to say that the only thing it worth seeing is the very last scene with the two teens camping out on Earth-2. To my mind, Mika Ward has the most beautiful woman's back in the whole movie history. She's SO sexy even when shot in a dark environment and only from the back. Really! Good acting (how does she move!! wow!!) and camera work here, pretty good. But that's the only good thing about this movie. The rest of the movie is terrible.The site says I have to write anything else about this crap. It's nothing special to write about: typical Jason in a typical Hollywood science-fiction movie. The silly one. P.S. But - RIP, dear Mika Ward.

Hitler invading Poland was the worst thing to happen to the world until this movie came out. This is truly awful. I can't even tell if it is actually suppose to be scary or funny or what. I feel sorry for the actors, I understand that actors need to get their foot in the door somewhere even if the movie is this horrible. Whats the plot of this movie? Whatever it is, its not a very good one. I don't like Jason part 1 through 9, I don't think they are scary, just very loud and gory, but at least they are movies and somewhat tolerable. I don't understand what these random killings and hormone driven teens are doing. Why are teens a spaceship? Why does he kill everyone and why doesn't he just kill everybody already? Must he torture us with horrible movies while doing so? What is his purpose? What will he do after everyone is dead? Sit around? Why can't people kill him? When some one shoots him he just keeps coming, its gotten old and predictable. Why even fight? You know whoever fights him is gonna die. They can at least humor me and if thats the case, why even make a movie? The answer to that is money and the existence of this movie can only be explained and justified by Hollywood trying to milk another penny out of a series of movies that for one, I never liked, and two, is growing very old at a very fast rate Horrible.

Am I right in saying this is the worst Friday the 13th ever? This movie ruined the whole name of Jason Voorhees and Friday the 13th.The acting sucked, the story sucked, I mean, what in the hell is Jason doing in outer space? The comedy sucked horribly, and was not scary whatsoever! Also, the way they killed Jason in the end would have to be the worst Jason ending ever. Getting sent flying to Earth 2? Bleh.The only remotely good part was where he got transformed into Uber-Jason, and that part wasn't even that good.Finally, the deaths of the crew: Horrible. When you compare deaths like getting head bashed against a wall with getting your head punched off? No contest.In all, this movie deserves 2 stars.

Man, I was so ready to have fun with this one...unfortunately it hovers somewhere between Part 5: A New Beginning and Part 8: Jason Takes Manhattan. Not nearly enough gore or creative killings (especially after all the talk of including such), and they spent so much time on making the movie LOOK so much better than the other entries in the series that the bad script and acting REALLY stand out. They also really went overboard with the nods to the Alien series. I even half expected Rowan (Lexa Doig) to come out in a power loader ("Get away from her you bitch..uh...you b**tard!") It could have been so much cooler...a better editor could have even made it kick ass. As such, there are two, maybe three pretty damn cool parts in the flick, and the rest just makes me feel like a tool for supporting this movie for 3 plus years. Judging from the audience response, enough people dug it for it to make money, which means a greenlight for Freddy Vs. Jason. Now they just need to call me so that I can do it the right way, and not get some hack that directed a House sequel at the helm.

I felt really lucky to be able to see JASON X in Stuttgart on the closing night of the Fantasy Filmfest. It was my first chance to see a Jason film on the big screen as the series went direct to video in Germany a long time ago. So standing in line for a sold-out showing of a Jason sequel in Germany used to be quite impossible to imagine.I should add that I'm a big fan of 80s slashers and the FRIDAY THE 13TH-series. My favourite Jason films so far were PART 2 as it's the scariest and Part 6: JASON LIVES that started to celebrate Jason as the unrivalled hero of the series. I had high expectations for JASON X but it still had to live up to an entire series of films I really enjoy.I can tell you it did. First of all the special effects looked really good. This isn't THE MATRIX but considering the quite low budget the space sequences looked fine. Of course, space is not what the film's about. Unsurprisingly, I was pretty sceptical when I first heard about the space setting. But this film is still about Jason and the makers aren't afraid to admit it. It really shows that both director James Isaac and screenwriter Todd Farmer are fans of the series. While Michael Myers didn't play enough of a role in HALLOWEEN: H20 for my taste, Jason is at the centre of this one. And there's no tendency to make him less evil or violent, either. There is some humour in JASON X, but that has always been part of the series. This isn't a self-ironic sell-out to audiences that are used to bad and boring films like VALENTINE and URBAN LEGENDS being called horror. JASON X is basically an 80s slasher flick with a higher budget. So if someone has a problem with the concept of a superhuman, unstoppable killing machine being the hero of a franchise, JASON X probably won't win them over. But if you like slasher flicks and therefore don't expect this to win Academy Awards I can hardly imagine anyone being disappointed. You've got your masked psychopath, a supply of pointy objects, gory and surprisingly creative kills (in particular Jason's first one aboard the space ship) and of course lots of potential victims that have no idea what they're up against. On the other hand there could have been more suspense. In that respect JASON X is similar to JASON LIVES which is fun and spectacular but doesn't really try to scare the audience too much.While two thirds of the film are good without necessarily presenting anything new, the last half hour actually has a few unexpected surprises including one of the most nostalgic and funny sequences in horror film history. I don't want to give it away but once the score from Part 1 starts playing and Jason finds himself in a familiar place fans of the series are in for a real treat. I also liked the ending very much that once again pays tribute to the series. I definitely left with a smile on my face.In conclusion I can say JASON X is the best new slasher / horror film I have seen in a long time. It has some modern elements, but it stays true to the series. I definitely recommend it!

reviews.review_title: The first horror sequel in space to pull it off.
reviews.content: I expected worse considering the sorry state of horror sequels lately and the idea to put Jason in space but this movie was done well. It makes good use of gore without becoming a complete splatter-fest (I know, that would have been nice). The space scenario wasn't abused, they didn't have all sorts of high-tech gadgetry to use against Jason and when they did pull out some futuristic stuff, Jason just hacked his way through it. Almost all the people on the "transporter" were late teens/early 20s and, of course, the girls are hot. You get the prerequisite breast shots and pre-marital sex to raise Jason's ire. Also, there is some good intentional humor, essential in cheap horror movies. There is a bit of cheesiness present but not much and the movie keeps good pace and is entertaining.

reviews.review_title: Jason X had me looking over my shoulders
reviews.content: Okay a lot of people I know is giving Jason X pretty bad reviews. People has told me time and time again that Jason X wasn't a good horror movie. To me, it was one of the best. All the other Jason movies had me laughing at others who seemed to be bothered and scared by Jason. This Jason movie, Had me scared. The first death scene was pretty gruesome and the way that those poor people were STUCK on a spacecraft with virtually nowhere to run to made it more scary to me. There are similarities in characters from this movie to the others..The lines that they say...like, "he is dead!", "we are safe now!" those lines we have heard over and over on all of the Jason films. But in my opinion, you have to have some common ground connecting this film to the other films. This Jason IS in a league of its own however. Its better than the Rest!!

reviews.review_title: He slices, He dices, He....well slices and dices..
reviews.content: Well Jason's back, and having seen all of the previous entries to the series, I was quite looking forward to this one.  Thankfully it doesn't dissapoint and overall is a pretty good slasher movie (which may not be saying a lot for some, but you've got to judge it based on what it is). Jason does the same thing he did in the previous Friday movies, just this time he does it in space.  Acting is fine for this type of movie, which again, isn't saying much, but they hold their own.  The story isn't exactly the most well developed, and it doesn't quite pick up where Part 9 left off. I guess Jason got lost in route to hell. Anyways, the movie is good, Uber Jason is pretty cool, but Im not sure if he could be sustained for a whole movie, but if Jason X makes any money at all at the box office, I'm sure we'll find out (and maybe even if it flops).

reviews.review_title: Pure utter cheese that is so bad its not even good
reviews.content: Jason X is complete utter garbage that tries so hard to pull itself off as a high budget sci-fi flick.  It basically looks like a Fullmoon direct-to-video flick, but with a higher budget than any fullmoon film. The basic plot is that Jason is frozen at Camp Crystal Lake facility in the year 2004 (I think) or 2007 and then 4.55 hundred years later he is thawed out and brought back to life by a scientist and his college students.  And get this, it takes place in space. Ok, you already knew that and so didn't I going into the movie. Hell I should have used common sense to steer clear of this, but I wanted to see a cheesy movie and Jason X oozed with it. I went and was expecting what I saw in the trailer, a roller coaster, horror cheese fest. Was I wrong though about it being somewhat decent. There is no suspense or thrills, like in the other Friday the 13ths, in this flick and the dialogue is dry and utter nonsense.  "Its ok guys he just wanted his machete back." UGH!!!  Or how about the line when one the guy (don't remember his name or any of the characters because they weren't important except Jason) is thrown on a giant screw. One of the soldiers finds him dead and get this when the captain asks the man's status the stupid bitch replies, "he is screwed." Oh dear.  Every hallway in the god damn ship has no lights. They have the technology to bring people back to life, but they don't have the intelligence to put lights in a space ship. I expected gore and rather twisted, but cool death scenes and I was disappointed once again except for one death. Just one and it was when Jason froze the hot blonde's head and then shattered it to pieces against the counter. Poor thing. Why do the hot ones always die in the beginning? Even the cutest guy was butchered 10 mins later. Dammit. At least both of them had small parts and won't be remembered being in this crap pile.  Anyways, the only good scenes were Jason's upgrade and the virtual reality camp Crystal Lake.  Oh god that was funny and possibly the best, demented sick humor I have seen in a while, those poor female campers. HEHE!!! Although, it has some good scenes the rest of movie is just plain horrible cheese that is so bad that it's not even good. Wanna see good cheese rent Jason Takes Manhattan (which is almost bad as this trash hole) or Jaws 3. The worst of the Fridays.

reviews.review_title: By far the best Friday the 13th...
reviews.content: Well boys and girls, it's that time again. Time for another Jason/Friday the 13th movie. Being an Gen X'er who grew up with these movies, I have to say, when one thinks about it, this is quite an accomplishment for ANY movie franchise. I mean, how many movies make it to a -10th-, outside of the porn industry, that is? Sure, it may not be academy award winning stuff, but it's fun popcorn entertainment nonetheless. In this particular sequel, the series finally takes the well-advised turn into sci-fi-horror-humor. There are some sincerely funny, dry-wit one liners in this movie. And of course we have Jason, who, like that battery bunny just keeps going and going and going... The movie finally changes the general scenery from the other films and jumps 450 years into the future, which may not make much sense until you actually watch it, but it does make for an interesting twist in the series. Of course, as with all the previous Friday's, there are an abundance of wildly creative death sequences, a bevy of beautiful, unheard of, actors and actresses, all of whom are fodder for Jason (Kane Hodder). But then, let's be honest, if you're watching this movie, would you be expecting anything less? Rooting for Jason to kill the beautiful people is what drives the series, in my humble opinion, and there is plenty of rooting to be done in this one. Near the end of the film we get to see Uber-Jason. Futuristically reconstructed and even more unstoppable, if that was even possible. On top of all that, we even get a hilarious throwback to the very first Friday the 13th (think sleeping bags). In the end, this movie is just plain fun and well worth a trip to the theater. But if you miss it, don't worry..  the movie clearly sets up a possibility of Friday the 13th Part 11. >

reviews.review_title: One of The Best In The Series!
reviews.content: Spoiler Alert Even though this one will never be equal to the original Friday the 13th, this one is probably the 2nd best out of the entire Friday the 13th series with the original at the best.  I went into this movie expecting a great addition to the series and thats exactly what I got.  I am a huge fan of the series, and after the disappointing Jason Goes To Hell, I was glad that Jason X wasn't so disappointing.First of all the plot is very original.  Putting Jason in space had always appealed to me.  I think the idea would be pretty cool.  And it was.Then there would be the killing and gore.  I think this one had great kills and lots of gore.  The killing was basically non-stop and if you weren't a main character, you'd probably get about 5 lines and then Jason would hack you up.  That's another thing I liked.I liked how Jason seemed more human in the beginning of the film.  It made the transformation into Uber-Jason more effective.  I thought Uber-Jason looked kick ass.The acting was cool.  The best actor was probably Peter Mensah who played the kick ass black guy Sgt. Brodski.  Lexa Doig who plays Rowan, the heroine did a good job as the lead chick.  Lisa Ryder was pretty funny as the android Kay-Em 14.  Chuck Campbell who played Tsunaron did a pretty decent job playing the smart dude.  Jonnothan Potts did a good job as the sleazy professor.  And Kane Hodder of course did great as the man behind the mask!The plot was great.  It was basically about how people managed to capture Jason Voorhees.  A scientist named Rowan (Lexa Doig) wanted Jason to be frozen until they found out what to do with them.  But then a militay group with another scientist come in and want to transport him out.  Rowan knows he's a killing machine but the other scientist wants to study him because of his amazing capability to not be harmed and his ability to reproduce tissue at a fast rate.  Then Jason awakes and kills the militay group and the scientists.  Rowan freezes herself with Jason by accident and then 400 years later a group of students discover her and Jason.In the future, Earth is a wasteland and people live on another planet called Earth II.  The students discover Rowan and Jason and think that Jason is dead but they believe they can bring back Rowan.  They bring her on the ship and bring her back.  They manage to bring her back and then Jason wakes up and begins to destroy students and marines (who are on the ship with students for protection purposes) until only a few students, a marine Sgt. Brodski (Peter Mensah) and the ships android Kay-Em 14 (Lisa Ryder).Kay-Em 14 gets an upgrade and basically anihilates Jason.  Then Jason gets upgraded on the regenerating table and becomes a metal hockey mask wearing Uber-Jason.  Kay-Em tries to stand up against him but Uber-Jason punches her head off!  Then Uber-Jason begins to slaughter the remaining students until only Brodski, Rowan, and a few others are left.  I won't spoil the ending but it's a must see!

reviews.review_title: The best worst movie I have ever seen.
reviews.content: I really enjoyed the old Friday the 13th movies, so when I first saw a commercial advertising Jason X, I knew I had to go see this one even though the movie looked horrible (haha).  This movie was unbelievably corny and silly.
