At least some of the original movies in the series were somewhat believable, but Jason X was so different and intentionally humorous that I'm sure a lot of people think the movie has destroyed the franchise which became one of the cornerstones of horror.If you haven't seen this movie, but have seen some of the first ones, imagine this: Jason Vorhees set loose inside a space ship much like the Starship Enterprise on Star Trek: The Next Generation (complete with Holodecks, I'm serious).  Yeah, Jason basically walks around this spaceship with his machete and kills everybody one by one.  It's so stupid that it's funny.  The story is absolutely horrible especially with the way the movie cuts from one scene to another.I thought the funniest part of the movie was*** SPOILER AHEAD ***close to the end when the original space ship blew up, yet Jason was flying in outer space towards the ship.  That was so silly -- probably the silliest thing I have ever seen in a horror movie, or any movie for that matter.If you're a fan of the series or the horror genre, obviously you'll want to see it.  If you're looking for a quick fix / good laugh, this is also a good movie for it.  I mean, you basically have to go into this movie already expecting it to be a little random and outrageous, cause that's exactly what it is.  I'd recommend most people to wait for it to hit the $1.50 theaters or even the local video store.

reviews.review_title: High frag-rate, low budget, no sense.... (minor spoilers ahead)
reviews.content: I was just in the mood and watched Halloween Resurrection and Jason X after another. Now i can hardly tell, which one was worse, i tend to this one. Well, i use to switch off my brain while watching Horror-Movies as it can't stand most of em for long and would gain a serious damage. Well, watching Jason X even the primary brain functions to perform life support are enough to see through this very thin story as it lacks of any surprises. To say the truth: The story is almost absent and can be told with just 11 words: Frozen Jason gets reactivated in future and kills people on starship. Ok, if it is well done, even that can be enough. In this case it is not. Seems like the director/writers of this movies just had played too much Unreal Tournament, at least Jasons Frag-Rate is the nearly the same and in the end he even gets a nice armour (well, as a player model it would look good in UT, indeed...). Sometimes they tried to make it a bit funny like scream but failed. So all what is left is  Jason killing people and even that gets boring after a while. For some decent Special FX and the nice Design of Jasons Armour it gets 2 points. For dumb characters in the movie that are -as usual in that genre- too dumb to stick together in a room and concentrate their firepower it gets one removed. Makes 1 point. If it helps to prevent part no. 11 i will give more, promised.PARA2K

One of the best ways to summarize this movie is in an analogy.  Jason X is to Friday the 13th as Bride of Chucky is to Child's Play.  Any person who expects this to be a frightening movie will be severely disappointed.  The movie is actually very very funny!There are a lot of problems with this movie that leave one asking these questions:  How did he get out of Hell?  What happened to Camp Crystal Lake? When did Jason grow hair?  How did Jason get so muscular?  How is Jason able to regenerate damaged tissue?  Why would anyone 450 years in the future know anything about Jason Voorhees?  Why does this look like a made for TV movie?  Why upgrade Jason to an invincible character (cloning him may have been a move)when no one's been able to kill him for the past 9 movies?  Why do they wait until the last 10 minutes to upgrade Jason?This movie has an unoriginal plot that is a blend of Aliens, Alien Resurrection, and the other 9 Friday the 13th movies; poor and predictable action, bland dialogue that is filled with puns that play on how Jason kills people, poor special effects, scenes that stop and forget to go again, stupid characters with no development and no intelligence that just won't die fast enough, and an outdated horror concept that is no longer scary.Altogether, it makes one of the funniest movies ever.  When I saw it opening night in the theater, everyone was laughing at it from beginning to end. It was so funny, I almost peed my pants!

I can't believe that that was part of Friday 13th movies!!!! I enjoy that classic horor since i was a teenager, but that... I am lost for words, I can't find any bad enough words to describe what have u done with that horors series. Damn u!!! How low will some people go for money making on old glory. Thank god I didn't pay to see that move but I just downloaded it from web. BLJAH!!!

When I went to see 'Jason X' I wasn't suppose to see it at all. I was suppose to see 'Spiderman', but it was sold out. So it was either 'Jason X' or nothing. So since I was already at the theater I bought some tickets. This awful movie should be scary, but it's funnier than it is scary. I gave this movie a 1. The worse you can get. This movie sucked!

Who would've ever thought Jason Vorhees would be back to terroize another group of unsuspecting people? I'm glad he did. Kane Hodder (Jason Vorhees) did a great job playing the role he was born for. Out of the 4 or so he was in, this is the best!

As you can tell by the plot, cast and trailer, This was bound to blow. This movie suck on so many levels -quote Roger Ebert. This movie had to be the worst horror movie since Leprechaun in space. If you are reading this, I highly recommend you to see halloween resurrection instead off this garbage.

Let's start of with this I gave this movie a 7, not because of the great acting, story or plot (basically there isn't really one), but because of what it delivers for the old-school slasher movie fans. I gives you lots of action with lots of gore, which you've grown to expect from these movies. I saw every single friday movie at least once  and from the jason series I think I liked this one best. Again....this kind of movie in only enjoyable if you like the genre, plain and simple. Don't watch it with your friends, because they won't appreciate this side of the horror scene, as they have become used to 'good story and creepy effects' movies like what lies beneath and the others.

reviews.review_title: Totally boring sequel to overrated horror-film-series.
reviews.content: I saw the movie last summer at the Fantasy-Film-Fest in Hamburg.I had seen the first two parts of the series.I expected no more than an entertaining variation of a theme.But instead i got an amalgam of no-story-script, lame pacing, no-actors and cgi-effects.A totally foreseeable storyline revolving around the resurrection of the frozen Jason through a team of university students and their professor in the future. Brought to their spacecraft and revived through nanotechnology, he promptly starts his famous walking-around-and-slashing-people. There are absolutely no surprises for even the dumbest horror-film-buff. Sorry, folks, but not even an nice try.The following maybe a Spoiler to some.Matrix-style fight scenes in which an latex-clad female android fires Woo-like her two guns at the foe. Who rises for the umpteenth time while the movie crawls to its end.But Jason-fanatics will see and buy it nevertheless.Yuck!

This movie is exactly what i was looking for in a Friday the 13th series. Death, more death, poor plot, nude girls and more death. Anyone that went into this movie expecting a nominee for best picture of 2002 should have stayed home. Of course its going to be corny and excessively violent, weren't the other movies? If you liked the other friday the 13th movies, this one will not disappoint you, sometimes you need a not so serious horror movie, this one delivers what is expected of it. I rated this 7/10 because it did just that. Gave me what i expected to see, standards were set and certainly met.

This might be the worst movie that I have ever seen. It definitely competes with Fargo and The Scorpion King for the title. Don't blow your $7.50 to watch this movie, but if you have to see it, rent it when it comes on video in the next month or so!

reviews.review_title: What the hell is this crap?!
reviews.content: Who in the hell makes these movies???  This sucks!  Don't get me wrong, I'm a HUGE fan of the "Friday the 13th" Series (well, I THOUGHT it was called "Friday the 13th"....what the hell is "JASON X"?).  Even though this is the 10th installment (I guess that explains the "X" in "JASON X") of what I thought was a series, taking into account that this movie has absolutely NOTHING to do with any of the other "Friday the 13th" movies, this film just doesn't cut it.  There's not enough gore like usual, the killings suck (c'mon, why the hell would the camera cut away when someone's about to get slaughtered by the hands of Jason Vorhees!), not enough nudity, and worst of all...we get the treat of seeing "horror get an UPGRADE" - a cyborg Jason Vorhees.  What the hell is that all about!?  The fact that this whole movie takes place in space on a damn wannabe Star Trek shuttle is no picnic either.  The only thing even remotely decent about this film was the Suburban Commando (hahaha) who wasn't afraid of Jason, as well as getting to stare at Lexa Doig for an hour and a half.  Other than that, if you're a true Jason fan, then you'll understand my disgust and pure disappointment for this piece of trash, and you'll do what's best and forget that "JASON X" was even made.  To all of you lame Hollywood producers and scriptwriters, I think Beavis & Butt-Head said it best, "PLEASE STOP IN THE NAME OF ALL THAT WHICH DOES NOT SUCK!"

First of all, damn all the people who rant on about how Jason X has bastardised the Friday the 13th Series. The series was really stagnant and needed to be completely ripped apart to make it entertaining. Here?s a tip about the real world of movies. They are mostly made for MONEY. But you can tell that this film also had a lot of love put into it. To just rehash the same script out just for a bunch of sad Friday fans would be the biggest waste of New Lines money. The film was greatly entertaining with no pretence that the whole genre has now ground to a halt. Other films like the Halloween series, Scream, I know what you did in the last movie, Urban legend, Valentine and the countless other Halloween and Friday 13th copies have made the slasher genre so predicable, that the ludicrous plot and sci-fi makes this film so refreshing. I totally urge anyone who doesn't have hang ups about change to see this movie. As the summary says, it's a no brainer, with great eye candy(effects and girls and gore). And it has definite replay value. Don't expect American beauty or Gandhi or anything thought provoking and you will have a great time.9/10

Just when you thought that they'd run out of ideas for Jason, out pops this great little flick. Jason X has a great mix of classic Friday the 13th, Sci-Fi, gore, and comedy. It has a very cool setting and for a Jason movie, the special effects are great. The camera work is very nice and the films ends with a wonderful shot. This movie was worth the money.

reviews.review_title: One of the Best Jason Flicks!
reviews.content: Combine equal amounts slash and cheese, throw in some clever humor, sprinkle on some gratuitous breast shots, set it in space, and this is what comes out of the oven: one of the most enjoyable Jason flicks of the entire series!! If you're a Friday the 13th Fan (and let's face it: who isn't? ahem...) you'll love this one. Don't listen to all those whiny film students (or film students-to-be) complaining about bad dialogue and cardboard characters. Those of us in the know realize it's easier (and a lot more fun) to see people you don't care about get stalked and skewered than it would be if you liked 'em too much.Most annoying character? I'd have to say the little brunette who said "This sucks on so many levels!" Yep, honey, and you're just about to be suckin' worse than you ever have. (I won't spoil anything, but you get the idea).High marks for style and humor, the acting is decent (except, again, that annoying smart-aleck girl), the murders are great, and the special effects are impressive. Similar in tone to Jason Lives (part 6) but higher quality. Lotsa Fun! You should see it!

reviews.review_title: Jason X won't win an Oscar but its definitely entertaining
reviews.content: I'm a big fan of all horror movies out there and specifically the Friday the 13th Series.  And Jason X is a great addition to the series; it is over the top and comical at times but what else can you expect for the tenth movie in a series.  Many people are bashing the movie and ripping it apart anyway they can.  Last time I checked a movie doesn't have to be the work of some frustrated artist trying to point out he flaws in our society or some other piece of trash preaching to me about what the artist feels is important to be entertaining.  If you are going to watch a Jason movie or any slasher flick then you should expect to see lots of killing and at times something comical thrown in.  If your going to see a story that says something like the Matrix or Requiem for a Dream then a slasher movie is not for you. Jason X delivers in all the ways that it should and like it should doesn't take itself too seriously and ruin the story by trying to make a Jason movie more than an unstoppable killing machine taking care of business with horny teenagers.  I highly suggest anyone who likes 80's slasher movies to go see this movie, you will not be dissappointed.  If your the type of person that orders a triple latte then maybe you should skip on this film and go rent a Disney movie.

I have seen every Friday the 13th movie on opening day at the theaters since part 6. This visit was the worth it. This movie rocks, not only as a well-made Jason movie but overall as a decent sci-fi slaughterfest! Slaughterfest it is, as it contains the most kills per movie than any of the previous films of the series. Being in outerspace also gives much more creativity to some of the deaths. It was cool to hear the audience cheer at the first deaths rooting for Jason, and the crowd laughing their butts off at some of the humorous bits in the film. Don't worry about not seeing the previous films before this one. If you know who Jason is, you will enjoy this film. Don't expect academy award quality. You won't find it. This movie is just pure fun from beginning to end.

reviews.review_title: Self-referencing horror films are a bad idea
reviews.content: Why is it that any entry or attempted entry in the Friday the 13th series ever since its original end (with Paramount's last Friday picture, Jason Takes Manhattan, in 1989) must be helmed by near mental patients who call themselves fans of the series? These so-called fans talk in interviews and commentary for this movie about their displeasure with some aspects of the previous films, and it is precisely these aspects that make the original films (say, the first four) so great.Personally, I think any kind of self-reference or humor in a movie like this is a bad idea. SCREAM already did this, and perhaps it opened the door for all the horror franchises it referenced to return and reference themselves in order to be "hip" again. That was undoubtedly a major factor provoking this film. Although tinges of reference to (also known as direct ripoffs of) earlier entries in the series are present in the first three fourths of the movie, it eventually degenerates into completely stupid parody. I see this as an affront to all of the original films and all those who remain fans of them.The space idea has been done or at preliminary developed in horror franchise after horror franchise, and historically it has never worked. JASON X succeeds not only in ripping off the earlier films (in attempt, of course, to be "chic" and "self-referential") but also virtually every classic space movie (2001, ALIEN, and ALIENS come to mind offhand). I don't think the consensus is clear yet whether this film truly "revitalized" the Friday franchise. But in order to regain its dignity, this franchise must not continue in this direction.

Bones are chilled and careers are ruined in this newest chapter to a story that will unfortunately never go away. Jason, as he is known to close friends, is reborn once more to wreak unspeakable horrors in space-a horrific realm with no oxygen, no gravity, and no plot. All hopes for a storyline were lost somewhere in the first few weeks of production...of the idea for this film. If Jason would simply explain how he manages to resurge so many times, or if anyone simply had the balls to ask him, I would not be nearly as frustrated. I guess I still just don't see what the big deal is. Plenty of people have died in lakes. What makes this cat sooooooo special. Maybe it's the mask. Somebody should really tell him that the Andrew Lloyd Weber look is out. Oh well. At the end of the film, Jason is reconstructed into UberJason, a glorified, gayer version of Spawn. This was stolen straight from obscure art film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: The Secret of the Ooze. The masked marauder of murder then survives several explosions and a virtual reality ruse before falling at the hands of a cosmic piggy back ride. The movie, like a derelict father, sends us to bed with no answers, just the heartwarming sensation that Jason is still alive and well. I just don't understand why anyone would fight him now. He's been to hell!! What's more extreme than that? Oh why couldn't he have been in other movies that sucked and killed all their characters? Ehem, Schumacher! Regardless, if you're looking for a good laugh and a reason to end your life, I would recommend it. It's good. Honest.

reviews.review_title: usual fair, not a bad thing though
reviews.content: Okay, no point in a long essay type report for this. Its Friday the 13th in space. More inventive ways to kill people, lots of comedy, and a fair bit of skin off the girls. If you don't like it, fair enough, but its a decent sequel in a series that was going down hill in even the fans view. The deaths are good, although a few to many take place off screen, and Lisa Ryder's character is absolute comedy. Don't expect a masterpiece, expect nothing, then nothing will disappoint you.

OK, anyone expecting depth, characterisation or any other such nonsense watching this is sadly misguided. It's a Friday movie, for God's sake!Certainly, this is the best outing for Jason for a while. The FX are good, and the acting is better than some Friday flicks. The basic idea is interesting enough, but moving contemporary horror icons into an SF setting has been done before (see Hellraiser IV).The big premise - Evil gets an upgrade - only happens in the last 5 minutes of the movie, which disappointed me. Uber-Jason needed more screen time to hold interest, as the first half mostly comes across as a mish-mash of numerous SF movies with a slasher element bolted on.If you're a fan of mindless horror/slasher flicks, you should enjoy this. Certainly better than most of today's direct to video junk.

reviews.review_title: As a comedy great, as a horror film, PANTS!
reviews.content: Well I think that the first place to start is by saying that as a comedy, Jason X rates fairly high up my scale of good comedies but as a horror film, basically, it lacked anything horrible!  Now I do realise that this is the tenth Jason Vorhees film and that the horror element has now been extinguished but in my personal opinion, what is the point of releasing yet another Jason horror film that simply isn't scary?  The most impressive element of this film is over and done with within the first two and a half minutes with Jason killing 7 people within that short space of time!  Even a critic of this film could at least be able to say that that was impressive! This adds to Jason's already massive body count of 191 people.  He is the killer with the highest body count out of all of the major horror killers to date.  I don't really think that the middle of the film needs explaining because if you have seen any other Jason films then you will know that the main bulk of the film involves gratuitous violence and some sex.I think that, at least in the UK, the demand for Jason films has dropped significantly and the first weekend box office takings show that they only made £233,090 whereas in the US they made $6.649 million.  Compare that to a budget of £14 million then you have got a small difference!  I could commend some of the actors on their performance but generally it is difficult to know if they can act when they are mainly having sex or running around being chased by and murdered by Jason.  Kane Hodder plays Jason again in Jason X and this film is his favourite.  I must admit though, a highlight further on in the film was definitely the Crystal Lake Campers and their top quote 'We love pre-marital sex!' and then the classic moment where Jason uses one of the sleeping bags with one girl in to beat the other the other girl in her sleeping bag. FANTASTIC STUFF!  No matter how much I dislike the rest of the film, at least there was another bit near to the end of the film to make sitting through the rest of the painful re-make worth while.  Overall I think that the film should have been portrayed as a comedy and NOT a horror film.

reviews.review_title: Good comedy aspects in this film but just tacky as a horror.
reviews.content: I believe that Jason X should never have been passed as a horror film. It is a comedy pure and simple. We begin with a completely unbelieveable first scene. Jason is trapped with chains, ropes, you name it yet he escapes and goes off in search of fresh blood. Excuse me but how does anyone escape from thousands of chains and rope?! I mean don't get me wrong this is quite a good film but it is far too unrealistic. Jason just happens to escape, then just happens to be thawed out of his trapped frozen state. Be real! It just wouldn't happen. I have to admit that this film did make me laugh, in fact it totally cracked me up. Jason becomes a robot of sorts.He tries to kill two girls by picking them up in sleeping bags and hitting them against a tree. What do they do? They laugh and say oohh, aaahhh! It's totally ridiculous. I think that was truly AMAZING. I mean what a classic comedy that would make! But no, looking at it as a member of the audience where was the horror?! There were no gruesome or especially frightening parts, there was just laugh after laugh after laugh!!! If this was meant to be a comedy I would say "Wow, what a great film." BUT it's not... It's a horror and a tacky, awful one at that. I wouldn't recommend this as a horror movie but if you're wanting a good night out and to laugh nonstop then go see this film. I give it 0/10 for horror aspects but a huge thumbs up and 10/10 for comedy! Go Jason!!!

Jason X - Review.'Evil Gets an Upgrade', describes the way Jason goes from being a supernatural killer, with a large knife walking through the forest, looking for revenge and not really knowing where he is going.Now Jason has a new look, 'a mean, lean fighting machine', dressed like a new version of Terminator. The outcome unfortunately, is a slightly funny, unrealistic, version of some of the classics, like Halloween and the first Friday 13th. Back then people wanted to see blood, guts and plenty of stalk 'n' slash, now all we get is people coming out with some of the worst lines ever, while they are face to face with the killer. People still want to be put into suspense and this film's only positive side is that it does add a few twists towards the end.Jason can never be killed, why Jason's victims don't start to do what they are supposed to do and get running, instead of standing in their in the face of death with not a chance in the world, is beyond knowledge, this will almost certainly add more scares and humour all on its own.Overall Rating: 3/10

This movie rocks, jason will never die, If the producers ever want idea's from me, e-mail me. I got an unlimited imagination. Just remember if they ever decide to end the series, The final plot should involve his father as being the real reason why jason is the way he. There should always be a final plot and jasons father is the only thing not mentioned yet. Maybe the reason he is always killing is because he's trying to kill his father for what he did to him. Since The series is in the future now, they will have to find a way to recreate Jasons father so Jason will finally Think he's succeeded in killing him thus letting his soul finally able to rest. Dimensions out.

reviews.review_title: Kills the idea of a good sequel.
reviews.content: OK...I like this series, and I admit, Jason X was "ok". But taking him to the future and into space just killed the idea of a good sequel. *Minor Spoiler*If they did make one, it would have to be on the planet that they landed on in the end. Other wise then just killing the series, it could have been worse. It was ok and deserves a 5/10. Believe me as a true fan there were much worse Friday's. I am also anxious to see what they do with Freddy vs. Jason.

I give it a 4 only because of one person in the film that did a decent job & that man's name is Kane Hodder. It's a pity this has been the last time he played Jason cause he does an exceptional job. I hope Hollywood casting directors don't blame him for the piece of crap.It was all the other actors that were god awful. It was poorly written. Not an ounce of creativety other than that woman that gets frozen & smashed into pieces. That was the most entertaining death you will see.I was quite bored by watching this except for the scenes with Hodder in it. I would rate this better than Jason goes to hell as there's more Hodder/Jason scenes though jgth was far more scarier & interesting.

Besides some funny bits the only thing of interest (and that is really streaching the definition of the word, "interest") is that the movie stars two of the actresses from "Andromeda" and the curiosity that Lexa Dotg who is a robot on "Andromeda" plays a human and "Andromeda"s human pilot (Lisa Ryder) plays a robot. Only watch if you are a completeist or want to have a Mystery Science Theatre party.

reviews.review_title: Although entertaining in places the film is poor
reviews.content: Although sometimes funny and shocking this film fails to deliver on a number of levels. There is so much killing, that by the half way stage the film becomes a monotonous killing fest, and even the director seems bored of killing characters off. However the film is very funny (though sometimes unintentionaly), especially when the robot gets an upgrade.

reviews.review_title: When will they stop this JUNK
reviews.content: Whatta crappy movie! Just watched it on encore channel today and felt like throwing up. Too much blood and bodies being chopped into half, faces being stripped off skin. Super sick movie. Guess, Hollywood has plenty of such sadistic/psycho directors. Don't know whats with the folks at Hollywood - all they think about is the great theme of WORLD-COMES-TO-AN- END and the protagonists have to save it.. or there's some bloody serial killer who goes on a killing spree. SICK OF Hollywood AND ITS MOVIES. Aren't there enough people out there who can make some nice movies that make sense instead of producing this trash. I wonder what the criteria for sensor screening. How could they pass movies like these? A Rating of 'R' is not sufficient for this movie. It should never have been allowed to be screened.

Well, my brother told me to watch this so I did. What a waste of money they spent. They could have had much better death scenes. Only one death was half-way futuristic. The movie is supposed to be in the future so people can die in cool ways, but no. Basically the deaths contained of him stabbing people and cracking peoples bones. How boring/lame. I wanted to see more blood and more gore, and more original ways to die. They could of easily had an awesome beam death, and an awesome futuristic weapon kill. I felt ashamed of renting the movie when it was over, and even more ashamed when I found out it was late. Wow. I do not recommend this movie. Go and rent the third Jason. It's possibly the best Jason movie yet. Jason VS. Freddy is okay, but the original Jason's rock. How about Jason X2 with futuristic deaths? Hopefully they can get smart and know how to create those kind of deaths, since it's supposed to be THE FUTURE. Oh well, 2 out of 10. Watch up to the first death and then turn the movie off.

reviews.review_title: Jason in Space... Could have been great.
reviews.content:
Jason X is a letdown, no doubt about it.  The trailer for the film looked like it would contain some campy fun, but only about the quarter of the movie really lives up to my expectations.  Maybe that is the problem I went into a 'Friday the 13th' film with expectations.The problem suffers the same fate as many horror franchises, lack of creativity.  Just seeing Jason Vorhees on screen is not enough reason to make a sequel.  Give the guy something new to do.  In this film they move Jason to a whole new setting, outer space in the future full of so many options to play with including technology, gravity, cool weapons, etc. but never take advantage of them.  Three quarters of the film could basically be from any of the previous nine films, except this one takes place on a spaceship.  I was hoping that the series would take some serious chances and almost reinvent itself like the campy horror film "Bride of Chucky" did. 'Chucky' was joy to sit through.  Sure it's not 'Casablanca', but I was entertained by the fact that I wasn't pedaled the same film as the previous three.  It strayed from the previous three films seriousness and tried some funny scenarios that were more tongue in cheek than I could have expected. 'Chucky' was a success and may have saved the dying series.
I can't say that about the 'Jason X'.  The film was given the chance and may have blown it.  People don't go to see the old horror franchises to be scared anymore.  Jason, Freddie, and Michael Meyers have become the heroes not the villains.  The directors have to start focusing more on giving the "villains" the right attitudes and unique scenarios than trying to make them creepy.  We all know Jason kills, now we want to see what happens when Jason tries to kill in zero gravity.  I thought the producers were going to try some new things with the Jason character in 'Jason Takes Manhattan'.  In the end that film turned out being just another 'F/t13th' film.  In both films 'Jason X' and 'J-Takes-Manhattan' they should have added fish out of water scenarios than looking for scares that never really add up to much.  'Jason X' could have been a hit if people were given something to leave the theatres and talk about.  All horror movie killings are the same.  Fifteen years ago they were a topic for discussion, now we want more than that.  As I said there are some redeeming scenes later in the film, that hit the exact note I was expecting to find throughout the film.  I won't reveal anything, because only if you pay to see this film do you deserve to know.I am sure when you leave the theatre (if anyone else goes to see this) thinking, why didn't they do more fun stuff like in the last 30 minutes? Maybe there were two different directors.  If I had a time machine I would go back ten years and find the guy who wrote 'JX' and put him on the right track.

I just saw this flick at the Fantasy Filmfestival in Cologne. To be honest, I never was the ultimate Friday the 13th fan, so I had really low expectations when going into the theater. As a matter of fact, I just saw the first 4 parts and think they are so-so. Jason X has not been rated (for Germany and for the US), so we saw the full uncut version in all its glory.As I said before, I had no expectations in this film. It took me completely by surprise, when I saw this great roller coaster ride full of fun and gore. Jason X doesn't take itself seriously and plays with the typical elements - just like "Bride of Chucky". There are plenty of gore scenes, which are very well done. The story... Well, do you really expect a story or characters? Jason X has only one priority: FUN.I have the feeling, that Jason X is made for the fans. Gore, twisted humor, nice ideas, typical elements (even Crystal Lake apears) and many little things only fans will notice. Everything they expected, they get here.I had a great time watching Jason X. Like it or be screwed...

I just spent 10 bucks to see this film and let me tell you - it is easily the most entertaining film this year.....it was absolutely horrible.......and thats what makes it great!  Outer space people!!!!  Come on - this is bound to be a hit, the lines are so bad, the concept is even worse, and even in 2450 - the chicks wear half shirts!!!  I literally p***ed my pants!!  Go see it and enjoy Gabe

reviews.review_title: The film keeps it's tongue firmly planted in it's cheek. The viewer should too.
reviews.content: Jason X is a lot of fun.  Most people talk about how horror movies aren't scary or how slasher flicks are all the same and many won't see this movie because they are "above" this kind of filmIf you go into the movie with the understanding that this movie is made for fans of the franchise and many of the laughs are there to be enjoyed, you will like this film.  It is one of the funniest movies I have seen in a while.Now, you may think that it is not meant to be funny and I am laughing at the film, but that is simply not the case.  I am laughing at the jokes and gags that were placed in the film by filmmakers that were probably laughing harder than I was when I watched it.Don't go in thinking this is a serious horror film, because it is not meant to be taken seriously.  It has its moments of scary parts and it has its moments of gore, but the basis of the film is that it is a fun film and should be watched as a simple, enjoyable good time.  On that level it succeeds very well.

reviews.review_title: Not quite as bad as expected.
reviews.content: Jason moves into the future to a space ship. It's ridiculous, fun and lots of gore for the Friday the 13th fans.

reviews.review_title: Jason X... Is It Worth It?
reviews.content:
HELL YEAH!...Well Yesterday February 10th, 2002 I was able to see an advanced copy of the upcoming 10th part to the Friday the 13th series which will hit theaters April 26. Before watching the movie I was excited but seriously had some major doubts, I mean Jason in space.. come on who would not have doubts about that? I also had some doubts about the Whole Upgrade Thing. Before I viewed the movie I had the feeling I was either going to give it a Mixed review or a Negative Review. I had no conception of giving this movie a Positive Review.Storyline: I thought the Story Line to Jason X was rather good, it's a change from some other sequels in the Friday the 13th series, but it was way better then "Jason Goes To Hell" and "Jason Takes Manhatten." The Movie was slow in certain moments but towards the end of the movie I realized it was for development and foreshadowing of what was to come. The idea of Jason in space I admit scared me a little and I was weary about it, but the writers pulled it off fine and did not go over the top with it and it did not seem to far-fetched.Directing: The director did a good Job with the movie and added some really cool CGI shots in the movie that were not cheesy or to manufactured at all. The CGI shots were rather nice and exciting.Cast: The cast I thought was really good. Fresh faces but also talented. There have been some major bad review concerning the cast in this movie stating they were aweful, but I honestly did not think so. Trust me I have seen WORSE. I thought they played this movie off well and were believable. There was annoying character but Jason obviously did not enjoy him either so I was happy.Kane Hodder (Jason Vorhees): Kane Hodder did once again an Amazing Job in this movie and made Jason so believable. It was also so nice to see Jason killing again. And man being frozen must have made him very angry becuase the Killing Was awesome. To tell you the truth I wasn't all into the whole Jason Gets an upgrade gig, but he was normal Jason with a normal hockey mask through out most of the movie. (by the way Hockey was outlawed in 2020 )
Death Scenes: They Were great and creepy. I think the best I have seen in the Friday the 13th Films and the most I believe.The Fans: I think most of the fans will enjoy it. Some may be iffy and in between with it. I dont think many will be disapointed. Oh and the fans will love one really cool part (my fav by the way)... the Crystal Lake sort of Flash Back thing.I recommend Many to go see this in April. I honestly believe it is worth it. I enjoyed it and give it a Positive Review. I give the movie 4.2/5. in other words High B low A.Joe

I have never before been at the movies watching a horror movie where people where laughing their butts off. I don't know what I was thinking when I paid my $6.50 to see this film and feel raped by seeing it. Contributing to its box office numbers pains me.The absolute worse part of the movie besides it being completely and utterly predictable was at the end when Jason becomes the Terminator. What the hell is that?!?!?  Has anyone ever just realized that the franchise has been squeezed to its limits.  Does no-one out there have enough connections to make a REAL horror movie.For us true horror fans it has been nothing but one enormous let down after another. I know 7 year olds that can tell scarier tales than this and they wouldn't need the gross amount of money that was flushed down the toilet to make this film.It was my choice to see this movie but we all make mistakes, especially when one still holds a shred of hope. Let me help you not make the same mistake and tell you STAY HOME!!! You couldn't pay me to see this movie again!!!

Let me start off by saying that I have been waiting for this movie for quite a long time, and let me tell ya folks, it was well worth the wait.  In fact, the day of it's premier was dubbed X-day by one of my friends and everyone took off work and school just to bask in the glory that is this movie.Now lets get to the cinematic masterpiece itself.  The first few minutes start off with the masked wonder and never leave him for very long.  That is the reason that I like this sequel more than any of the other ones.  There really is no break in the action.  I don't want to give anything away, so I will say that there are plenty of original and inventive death scenes, lots of gratuitous eye candy, and an ending that is a triumph of the human spirit. Let me be honest here, this movie has something for everyone.  For the guys it has hot ladies, cool weapons, lots of action, and space marines.  The ladies will also enjoy the film because of the romantic story line between that one guy and his cyborg. What the makers of this film have accomplished is nothing short of a miracle.  It is difficult to take a popular villain and simply place him in space.  For instance, while Leprechaun in Space was a quality film, it pales in comparison to the glory that is Jason X.  Another ingenious move these filmmakers made was putting it so far into the future.  This means they can make many more Jason movies to cover what happened in the years between.In conclusion, go see this movie.  Man's ability to create masterpieces like this gem does not happen every day.  Don't waste your chance to see it, you won't regret it.

This movie was a discrace to all the Friday The 13th movies. It was a joke and nothing more. In the originals there were'nt really funny scenes or funny quotes. In this movie I wouldnt classify this as a Horror movie but as a Horror/Comedy. That movie falls into the catorigory of Scary Movie. Although it was funny I wouldnt recommend this movie to anyone. Wait till it comes out on video to watch it.

reviews.review_title: the surroundings may change, the killing stays the same
reviews.content: It had been quiet for eight years, but James Isaacs decided to break the silence. The result: Jason X, Friday the 13th Part 10. Everyone expected something different of course, something spectacular. If not, it is very hard to wake up interest for a horror figure of the eighties. Everything around Jason X seems to live up to those expectations, but then after seeing the movie you realise nothing has changed. Jason is still Jason, a mass murderer with an Ice-Hockey Mask who doesn't say a word, just kills everyone he meets. In the first place it is not clear why Jason came back from the dead after the "final" chapter, Jason Goes To Hell: The Final Friday. Isaacs doesn't worry about explaining this. Besides the beginning goes very fast; we don't see anything of Camp Crystal Lake and Jason is send to space very quickly so you don't have time to analyse the details of his capture. Yes, Jason has been captured and now we find him in space. There the spectator knows it is going to be different, or at least that we be logical.No way. Jason is the same cold killer as in the former movies, kills in the same way and doesn't give any surprises. And when you get finally used to that, he suddenly changes physically,  at a moment the spectator already accepted Jason stayed the same, when he reminds the former parts from the 80's and enjoys those memories. So no one wants this Robocop version of Jason, except the real fans of course (beware of part XI!!). Jason X is a disappointment, in spite of the special effects and the presence of the very pretty Lexa Doig.

Certainly the most enjoyable of the Jason bunch (mostly due to the special effects now possible), Jason X provides an hour and a half of the expected mindless killing and frantic running around that we have learned to love. Refreshing are the methods that the cover boy uses to get rid of the menacing teenagers: the drill, the liquid nitrogen sink, but he certainly enjoyed using his machete in the usual manner (through skin, past the bone). Add a couple of one-liners by the hopeless crew, and you have yourself the perfect movie to enjoy without wasting precious gray matter!

reviews.review_title: Friday the 13th Fans will deffinately enjoy
reviews.content: Jason X...everything you could have wanted out of this movie and perhaps the best Friday since...well...I guess #7. As I think back to all the Fridays since the original, everyone of them had a part you remember well although the movie as a whole wasnt as good as it could of been. This movie does a great job coming up with new and unique ways to not only Kill Jason but doesnt take away from sequels (or prequels if you may)and really comes off as a whole movie that is very enjoyable and exciting. Not only does "evil get an upgrade" but the whole movie is a 14 million dollar marvel. They really squeezed every penny out of it. I was really surprised. I really hope these guys get another one out by 2004. Enjoy

reviews.review_title: I've seen a lot of poor films in my lifetime.....
reviews.content: 10/10 for my stick-ability, 1/10 for the movie. Poor acting, predictable lines, cheesy action. Music is a big part of making this movie as bad as it is. 450 years in the future, humans are still as inept to rid the universe of the slowest killer ever.

Jason X is 10 times more entertaining than The Cell.  If it does go to video which I hope doesn't happen, it will still be better than 90% of the dreck in the video store.  I just wish Jason had killed off some of the more irritating characters like dennis and adrian.

well,i was expecting this movie like hell,i got the chance and i saw it now,3 months before his premiere (a lot of people saw it...why?). here´s the catch,it´s a good movie,not as good as i expected to be,but much better than JASON GOES TO HELL,there´s not much gore stuff,well,depends on each taste,but the killings are a little soft (I WANTED TO SEE JASON KILLING MORE,AND WITH VISUAL)but hey,it has some cool moments. about uber Jason? i think it´s terrific,and it´s great the info about jason´s gift to reproduce himself. if u are a Friday the 13th fan,go to see it,of course,i not,well,depends on what u like,but i got to tell you that it´s much better than all the teen horror movies thing.i give jason x an 8,some good special effects too.let´s hope that the movie make enough money to do a sequel.
If not for the really cool scene where Jason presses the researcher's face into a sinkful of liquid nitrogen and then smashes it against the counter, I would have given it a 4.

reviews.review_title: Good, but not what I had hoped for
reviews.content: I just want to make a quick comment or two about Jason X. I love the Friday the 13th series, every episode, some greater than the others, some lesser. While I enjoyed Jason X, it was my least favorite of the series for a couple of reasons: 1) I don't like the future aspect. The main reason I liked the series so much was the woods/camp setting and was sad to see they made this one in the future and out in space. 2) The little one liner jokes so typical in today's horror movie. Jokes like that go before the killing  starts maybe, but definitely not during kill scenes. 3) So called ubber Jason, enough said. Ok, reasons why I did like it 1) Pretty good death scenes, some innovative. 2) The movie didn't drag out some, in fact the whole movie seemed pretty action filled, almost too much.Anyways, I just think the space thing has been beat to death. I was hoping this movie would come out and be the starting point to bring some horror like movies of the 80's and depart this late 90's early 00's scream like movies. I am happy it was made, any Jason is better than no Jason. I would love to see more and more movies in this series and the ending looked like they left something to work with if another one is decided upon.Take care and enjoy the movie.

I was surprised when I went to theaters to see Jason X.  This movie was the most unique out of all the movies in the Friday The 13th series.  For gore, it does one of the best jobs that I've seen yet.  The movie also is original in many aspects.  The first is that, well, the setting is in space, almost 450 years in the future.  The second is that Jason Voorheis gets turned into a terminator-like creature, unlike the normal hockey mask (although he does wear the hockey mask for the first 3/4 of the movie.  The movie also is a good way to end the series.  Ten.  I think that this was one of the better horror movies in the last ten years.
Just my opinion but people need to stop acting like this is the worst film in the world, or better yet, the worst film in the series. It's perfectly fine and a fun time overall.

reviews.review_title: One of the best slapstick horrors I have seen recently!(spoilers)
reviews.content: If your looking for continuity in this film, well, you're out of luck bub. This film jumps all over the place with you sitting there scratching your head wondering why the guy you saw doing the girl is with the rest of the people while Jason is right behind him. Shouldn't he be back in the bedroom making love to the girl? Well, who cares? Sadly, most of the film goes on like this with many things not being explained and we are taken on a magic carpet ride to an ignorant future! Wow! Other than these dissapointing aspects of the film, I found some scenes absolutely hilarious and this is well as it balances the rest of the movie that is horribly confusing and painstakingly slow some times. The retro scene has to be the best as I have never seen something so funny in my entire life. Kudos to the director and editor for that sequence. Also, as with most slasher flicks I expected a lot of T&A however I was greatly dissapointed until that retro scene, as there were next to no nudity in the entire film!!! Sure, the girls were mainly great but still, the only one I wanted to see nude dies 10 minutes into the film. In conclusion, I would give it many pluses to see Jason fling 2 sorority sweethearts around in their sleeping bags in the retro scene, but other then that I have to say that the film was slow, clunky, and horribly boring.

This was a fun and ridiculous over the top movie. The plot was completely nonsensical and just made zero sense. However some of the kills were very unique and imaginative plus the action moments was decent.

Here's what I was thinking, last time I checked if movies were going to be in a long line of sequels like the Jason movies they should have maybe a little bit of continuity between movies. Last time I saw Jason Goes to hell, Satan himself physically came out of the ground and took Jason down to hell with him. Hmm, so now 450+ years later some kids on a field trip and find him cryogenically frozen, wow so that's the eternal punishment given by Satan these day being cryogenically frozen at Camp Crystal Lake. I mean do these writers just assume that nobody watched the previous movie. I thought that Jason Goes to Hell was a fairly decent way to close the dynasty. Jason X looks like it's just going to be a bunch of eye candy with a weak plot. I just cannot understand why you would want to reopen this series after 9 years and especially after the ending of the last one.

reviews.review_title: Didn't do enough with the premise
reviews.content: I feel like people are way to hard on this entry. Pretty much the whole Friday the 13th franchise is wacky and ridiculous and Jason X is one of the few that's in on the joke and doesn't take itself too seriously. All that being said however, this movie still isn't as great as it could have been. Putting Jason Voorhees in space may have seemed like a cool idea in the writing room, and the concept art probably looked cool but this is just too much of the same, rehashed story we've seen nine other times before, just with a new setting. I certainly get why some people may love it but I just didn't think they did enough with the premise.

reviews.review_title: Jason X is a great ride!
reviews.content: Man, I loved this flick!  I have been holding out waiting to see it on the big screen and man am I glad that I did.  There are so many things that I loved about Jason X from the opening scene to the Crystal Lake simulation...this flick is totally entertaining and made to elicit laughter out of the audience.As I watch Jason X, I was reminded of the reason I love all of the Friday the 13th flicks...they give you a slight chill every now in then but for the most part they make horror funny...from the big breasted bimbo who thinks she hears something and keeps checking behind her until she gets distracted by something (or someone) and then ends up mincemeat to the fact that Jason always seems to twitch awake when he hears the panting of teenagers who are caught up in foreplay.This movie is totally entertaining and one that you definitely need to see in the theater in order to get the full effect...if you are looking for mindless fun and entertainment, go see Jason X!

I have seen the whole ten "Fridays.." and let me tell you this is not the worst of the series but the "future-space" idea is silly, the movie does not follow the previous one (I think none of them do) and the first half hour is BAD AND STUPID like the ending. It has very good killings and no suspense at all. Very predictable and, if you saw the trailer, you know it all. It`s better than: PART 7(the new blood),8(Jason takes Manhattan). The best are: the first one, of course, the third(3D), the final chapter (fourth) and the sixth: Jason lives.

I think that the new Jason X doesn't respect the original meaning of the old Jason movies. It's not even a scary movie anymore. With the robot and all those futuristic things.They've put to much jokes and sex in the movie, If I would want to see that I would have watch 40 days and 40 nights. I think that Jason was made for movies that's taking place in the present...

This movie far surpasses the last one (Jason Goes to Hell).  It's basically Jason on board Event Horizon.  The effects are great and the body count and remains faithful to the Friday formula.  Great comedic one liners. Hysterical reference to "the rules". Jason looks great.  Lots of fresh young faces.  Overall a great addition to the Friday series.  It's about time, a good sequel has been long overdue.  Is this really the end?

I`m a huge fan of the series...and this one was just great. I loved every second of it. Good look, nice cast, beautiful girls, big sounds and really fast paced. Why are there no more movies like this? If you like a movie that keeps you highly entertained then check this out.

reviews.review_title: One of the most uninspiring movies ever
reviews.content: Sure, everyone wants to see the new Jason movie this year. But for those of you who are reading this and have not seen it yet, save your money and rent it (maybe). This film is riddled with bad acting, a very poor storyline and not enough content to keep anyone, including myself, interested through out the course of the movie. The few things that I liked about this movie was some of the comedy aspects, how the new Jason came to be and the suspense, as in any Jason movie. But the suspense feeling quickly faded. I was very disappointed in this movie, the storyline and the acting. As I said, honestly, save your money for this one. Joey

reviews.review_title: Why cant he just stay dead!!
reviews.content: I have seen this movie and all i can say is it sucked in the last Jason movie he goes to hell and was that not enough then all of the sudden they find him on a plant frozen way in the future it does not make any sense. Then to top it all off he turns into some robot thing which makes this movie even worse then it can already be.

I am a really big Friday the 13th fan and I can tell you I was REALLY disappointed in this movie.A few years ago when I first heard the story line for Jason X I thought "Oh no, Jason in space in the future! This is gonna be bad." But over the last two years I heard great things about this movie so I thought maybe it really would be good.As the movie drew closer and I saw the trailer online, I realized that my initial impression was probably right. I went to see it anyway because I am a fan. But I went in expecting a bad movie.I was wrong. It was not a bad movie. It was a HORRIBLE movie!! The acting was bad and the plot was shallow. Know the background theme throughout the previous movies when Jason is near? Also missing. I was either laughing at this movie or I wanted to leave.In summary, I beg all you fans to WAIT UNTIL THE VIDEO! Don't waste your money on this garbage. Jason take Manhatten was better, and saying that is pathetic!

this was one of the best recent horror movies that came out since Jason Goes to Hell.the year is 2455(wow we`ve hit the fast forward button)anyway Jason and the woman who tried to freeze him are no aboard a futuristic ship going to Solaris(a space station i think). they first revive the girl then Jason.of course Jason goes on a killing spree,the first one is always the best(don`t play with liquid nitrogen).anyway the movie carries on with killings and the crew trying to destroy Jason. the android on board,then blows our happy cleaver weilding friend to bits,and he unfortunatly lands on a regeneration platform. This is when he gets an upgrade. i won`t say much else but it`s a great movie for a true horror fan.

reviews.review_title: Better then expected, but still too predictable..........
reviews.content: I was pleasantly surprised when I saw this movie with my friends this weekend.  It does have a plot, though very miniscule.  It basically starts where Jason has been captured (they don't explain how) and is being held at Crystal Lake research facility.  That is some damn stupid; crystal lake was a camp, not a huge government facility.  And does anyone else find it dumb how the writers totally disregarded the ending for Jason Goes to Hell.  My friend told me that Jason vs. Freddy is supposed to be a prequel to this, though I haven't heard that.Along with the story, Jason and this girl are frozen in a capsule for over 400 years because of reasons that would be considered spoilers.  When the people from Earth 2 come to visit Earth 1 (which is desolate now) they find one survivor (the girl) and a dead corpse of Jason.  The story complexes as both are brought on the ship, and both come back to life. I will assure you that there are decent killings.  The funniest and sexiest part without A DOUBT is when he is pulled into a "vison" of Crystal Lake in 1980. The ending........again.....opens to door for ANOTHER sequel.I give it a 7 because I thought it was a good addition to the series, but lost points because the the super-Jason part was the stupidest idea I've ever seen.

If your not into jason, dont go see it, if you dont laugh at bad acting dont go see it, if you dont think the plot is laughablely lame , dont see it. If you expect that, go for it you wont be disappointed, it was laugh out loud funny!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: Once again, we're fooled by trailers
reviews.content: "Evil Gets an Upgrade".....for the last 15 minutes of the movie.Once again, we're fooled by trailers.The deaths are your usual Jason fare, some "inventive", but not nearly enough(the face smash scene is pretty cool).In the last nine years that's all they could think of? Uber Jason could've been awesome, but instead we're given old school Jason in an "Alien"-like atmosphere for most of the movie.I don't know what number is higher,the body count or the loopholes in the plot. Do yourself a favor and only watch the retro scene in the end and then you can say you enjoyed this movie.

reviews.review_title: 80's Horror, resurrected with a sci-fi twist!
reviews.content:
The 80's classic "Friday the 13th" enters new realms in 2002, with the rebirth of its infamous character, 'Jason Vorhees'.  Melding sci-fi with horror, director James Isaac brings Jason back to our screens for another helping of blood, gore and horror! Set in space in the distant future, Jason unleashes his terror upon a space crew, traveling home.  With familiar plot turns n twists, this sadly bland and conventional horror movie fails to achieve what the first installment in the original "Friday the 13th" legacy did so well.  Original fans of the legacy will probably feel great disappointment with this trans-generic horror "wannabe".  However, those unfamiliar with the original movies should be pleasantly satisfied, watching in awe, engaged in the many scenes of gut-wrenching, senseless, violence and tongue-in-cheek humor.  Although incredibly tedious and tiring to watch with the many thwarted attempts to kill Jason that we've seen oh so many times past, this film is perfect for those in the need of a quick gore fix.
"Jason X" - Predictable and very tongue-in-cheek.Rating - 3/10

If you are looking for a good movie, Skip Jason X. This was by far one of the Worst movies I have seen. This was one sequal that should never have been made. The plot was very predictable, as you know from the other 9 chapters in the Friday the 13th Series Jason Voorhees can't be stopped no matter what happens to him. The story was more funny 'and I mean funny in the stupidity of the film' than it was scary.It's now the year 2455 and Jason is back, the movie goes much like all the other in the series. Jason Kills whoever gets in his way, everyone tries in vein to knock Jason off but he keeps coming. For some viewers of the film the high point of the movie would be when Jason gets an Up-Grade and is transformed into Super-Jason fresh with a bullet proof armor and a New mask. As the movie progresses to the end, you find yourself looking for a way for the film makers to make yet another sequal. And, you won't be dissapointed. Now he has a whole new planet to terrorize. If you like stupid predictable movies than go see it. If you are looking for a movie that is worth the money, go see something else.

I just saw the movie for the first time tonight.  I must say it wasn't one of the better Friday the 13th movies. Of course Jason was this unstoppable machine, which is cool and all, but the storyline and script were terrible. There weren't very many killing scenes that were all that great.  The ending was horrible. Of all the ways they could have killed Jason, they decided to do it that way. Grant it it is leading up to another movie, but they could have thought of a better ending than that.  I mean with all the recent horror movies that came out the past couple of years weren't that bad. Halloween H2O wasn't all that bad and it had a good story. I never understood why they decided to take the Alien type storyline for this movie. The one good part of the movie was when Jason turned into Cyborg-Jason. The outfit was cool and so was the fact that at the end of the movie he ends up back in Crystal Lake where he first died.  If you want to see this movie because you are Jason Vorhees freak like I am, then I say see it. But if you want to save $8 then stay home and wait for it to come on video and rent it. Hopefully when the next one comes out it will be a bit better. The Halloween Resurrection trailer looked pretty decent.

Jason X isn't the greatest Jason flick of all time but it's not the worst either. Lexa Doig pulls off a good performance showing that she is able to play something other then a android/warship, hopefully we'll se more movies from her. Obviously a continuing problem in Jason is the fact that NO WHERE is it explained on how Jason came back from Jason Goes to Hell! Which this isn't the first time this has been done. They also continue in changing Jason's appearance from Human, to weird freak, back to almost Human. But I guess depth of story was never the point of Friday the 13th only death. On the bright side of this movie it has what will most likely be viewed as the definitive death scene of the Friday the 13th series. I can't say now because it's only in the theater, but all will know it when they see it.

First you should know I'm a BIG F13 fan.  Jason X starts out at Crystal Lake Research Facility, where the subject Jason Voorhees is being prepped for cryonation. However, some militrastic pencil pushers decide that they could benefit from his DNA. Naturally, he gets free, kills some people and stalks the booty-licious scientist that originally wanted him to be cryogenetically frozen.  She accidently freezes herself and Mr. Voorheees.  455 years later, a space crew finds both of them, takes them to their ship and was able to revive the scientist, not Jason.  As you might expect Jason lives anyway and (in violent fashion) all hell breaks loose.This is one of the better films in the seires, but will never be as good as Parts 1 and 6.  It also contains one of the most coolest, original deaths ever that involves nitrogen.  The effects were good, the story good, the acting..... When did that ever matter in an F13 movie anyway?  Kane Hodder once again dominates the Jason persona, especially the brand spaking new "Uber" Jason, a large Robot.  This is also the first film in the series that takes the Dark Comedy movie, like so many other franchises today (Nightmare on Elm Street, Child's Play, etc.)Overall this was a good film.  Even non-fans might like it. 7.5 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: This review is better if you've already seen it
reviews.content: Jason X wasn't terrible.  I hated part 9 (Jason Goes To Hell), so I wasn't annoyed really that there was no explanation given as to how Jason got out of hell since that movie never gave an explanation as to how Jason, who had been turned back into a boy because of the nuclear waste in the New York sewers, actually got back to Crystal Lake from Manhattan.  Maybe someday they can go back to that plot line.  'Till then, maybe they can go back to a somewhat more traditional Friday The 13th movie with the next one.  Earth II's atmosphere has burned off the Uber-Jason crap, so he can look like the big, dirty hick he is if they choose.  It's just too bad that the original hockey mask, which had been pretty faithfully recreated in every sequel since it came into being in part 3, had to get blown up on the space ship.This movie was not scary.  Maybe it wasn't supposed to be.  It lacked in suspense for some reason.  In this movie, pretty much from the get-go, the people know there is a killer on the loose, they know who the killer is, and they know what he looks like.  He's actually being hunted.  What made the first 8 movies good (for the most part) is the people being killed don't know what's going on (except for the final 3 or so people that are left towards the end of the movie).  They're not expecting it, so it's more suspenseful or scary for the audience.I think this movie LOOKED good at least.  It's not going to look AS dated 20 years from now as the original Fridays do.  As most people have said, the best kill is the smashed frozen head.  Along with the virtual killing of the girls in the sleeping bags (which was done in part 7, and was the best killing in that movie).  The music in the virtual Crystal Lake scene...getting back to the classic atmosphere...was a welcome change.  I hadn't really noticed the music at all throughout the movie, but when the classic sound returned, it really hit home how important this was to the early films, and how it should return in future films.I wouldn't rank this sequel too high.  Better than the last one, and perhaps better than 8 and 5, but even those two had some scares.  This one may get the edge because it looks good and for the virtual Crystal Lake scene. Part 6 is by far the best though, despite not having Corey Feldman come back as Tommy.  But I've got high hopes for the next installment.  As long as the campers on Earth II don't know what's happening till about 3/4 of the way through the movie, and if they put in a few "easy scares" like the cat jumping through the window, I'll be happy.  Actually just leave the "magic knife" crap from part 9 out of it and I'll be happy.

First of all, I''m a huge Jason fan.  I even liked Jason Takes Manhattan and Jason Goes to Hell.  They all have great aspects to them.  The first couple are actually somewhat scary, but after Jason's first official "death," the films became pure emphasis on kills.Jason X lacks the suspense of its predecessors, but it provides just as much, if not more fun than most of them.  It doesn't take itself seriously, which is good.  Around 10 movies it's hard to take something like this seriously.  Some sequences are outright hilarious, such as the homage to the sleeping bag death scene from part 7.This was my first experience of Jason in the theaters, and I must say it was magic.  I got stuck with a crowd that were all fans of ole Jay.  There were cheers at each kill scene; some cheers, I even initiated.  It was a lot of fun.  As a devout horror fan, I came close to shedding a tear by the time the night was over.  It was just magic to me.  Jason X was so much fun and is an homage and parody on itself and the genre.Great ending as well.  My only problem was the lack of suspense, but I think the film made up for it just fine.  I loved it.

***possible spoiler alert***Overally, I was pretty impressed with the latest addition to the absolutely knackered friday the 13th franchise. Of course, this film won't win any awards for originality (or anything else for that matter), but never-the-less it's a pretty fun ride to watch which includes some hilariously bad one-liners ("it'll take more than a poke in the ribs...."). At first glance, the prospect of the film being set in space seems a somewhat... well... rubbish one, mainly because horror films in outer space seems rather dated these days and doesn't often pay off *ahem leprechaun 4*, but I think this only adds to the film's limited charm. Because of this we get a breath of fresh air for the Friday franchise, finally getting away from the now tedious Camp Crystal Lake and giving the fans something new to look at. I liked this film but honestly, the "uber-Jason" resembles a power ranger on steroids.my rating: 6/10

This was one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I like somethings about the other Friday the 13th movies. This one made me want to gouge my eyes from my skull. The acting was terrible, the effects were cheap, and the premise was absurd. After seeing the movie I wanted the hour and a half of my life back. My advise avoid this movie at all cost.

MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS!!  To start out I would like to point out that HE'S IN SPACE!!!!  He died more than 6 times already and came back each time.  I thought I that he got sucked into hell in his last escapade, but somehow he becomes not only frozen, but he is in the future...IN SPACE!!  Why is he in space!!!! He died more times than I can count.  My friends went to go see it (me being the smarter of the group), I stayed back.  Well, my friends demanded their money back after 20 minutes of crap, saying the best part were the previews.  I still can't get over the fact that he is alive and in SPACE!!!  Was this written by a monkey, or maybe a donkey?  Either way, don't waste your money on this nonsense.  This movie makes seeing "Kung Pow: Enter the Fist" look like academy award looking material.

reviews.review_title: Trying to be rubbish doesn't make a film good it makes it rubbish
reviews.content:
Jason x is an intentionally sarcastic film. It is meant to laugh at itself. The fact that coincidence after coincidence occurs to bring Jason back to life, is meant to be unrealistic. It isn't meant to scare the audience it is a film made for Jason fans. It was made so the fans could see Jason doing what he does best which is killing the fact that the audience knows the plot even before they've seen it makes it better for the audience as they feel like they know something the characters don't. The fact however is that even though I accept it was making fun of itself it didn't make it funny. It was tiring to sit through some thing that is obvious from the outset. Just because it was meant to be obvious doesn't stop it being boring. I feel the space setting and also the future setting could have been funny but the one liners were constantly playing on the fact that people in the future are stupid. Several times one of the girls questions what the girl from the past is saying, 'what's a bike' what's this? What's that? What is meant to be funny about repeating the same crap joke over and over again?
4/10

reviews.review_title: Jason X is not what i expected.....
reviews.content: Before I went to see Jason X I thought it would be yet another dodgy, predictable horror movie where everyone dies bar one fantastic character who manages to survive at all costs. Jason x (being set in space) was a turn up for the books!Sure it still had the cheesy plot of Jason the un-killable maniac who slashers all the cast one by one starting first with the sexually active.Though, the methods used by Jason to kill the cast were new and more grousem, i especially liked when Jason dipped a girls head in a deep freeze nitrogen solution and then smashed her face open on a table. The comedy was frequent but quite dry.The polt was different but still cheesy,unlike the other Friday the 13th movies this has a nice twist to it and is parallel with Nightmare on Elm street now with the comedy used in Jason x.

Jason X was silly, dumb, stupid and had a horrible plot.  Add in some bad acting, and whamo - you have the makings for a fun Friday the 13th sequel.While it isn't a great movie, it is still a fun watch.  Like others have said, if you want to have 90 minutes of fun, go ahead and watch it.  If you are going to be critical of all the errors and stupidity in the movie, skip it because you just won't enjoy it.I thought they went a little over the top with the sci-fi angle, but I guess since it's in the future all can be forgiven.  Besides, Jason still kills a whole lot of people for no other reason than to kill them and that's alright with me.I wouldn't give this movie much more than 2/4 stars, just because it's a cheesefest, but in comparison to other Friday movies, it stacks up. Besides, its fun and sometimes when you go and rent a flick, you just wanna have some fun.

Jason X is the tenth film in the slasher film franchise that takes Jason Voorhees, the undead killer who haunts Camp Crystal Lake, to a new location: outer space. The film follows a group of scientists who discover Jason's frozen body in the year 2455 and bring him aboard their spaceship. However, Jason thaws out and resumes his killing spree, while also facing a new enemy: an android named Kay-Em 14, who is programmed to fight him. The survivors must find a way to escape from Jason and the spaceship, which is on a collision course with a space station.

The film is directed by James Isaac, who also produced the film along with Noel Cunningham. The film stars Lexa Doig, Lisa Ryder, Chuck Campbell, Jonathan Potts, Kane Hodder and others. The film also features the return of Kane Hodder as Jason, who plays the role for the fourth and final time.

The film is a silly and campy entry in the franchise, as it tries to mix horror and science fiction with mixed results. The film is more comedic and self-referential than the previous ones, but it also has some action and gore scenes. The film is not very original or realistic, but it is fun and enjoyable for fans of the series.

Jason X is a cheesy and amusing slasher film that takes Jason to a new frontier and a new century.

I love this movie. I find it to be very underrated and over-hated in my opinion. After the godawful mess that was Jason Goes to Hell, this was actually a lot of fun to watch. I know it isn't a good movie, but it's one of the most re-watchable movies in the franchise, especially when you're with your friends and drinking alcohol. I thought the cast was entertaining, and while the characters weren't super interesting, I feel that they still had a good screen presence. The final girl Rowan was pretty good, but I think there was more that could've been done with her, especially with her being frozen in time with Jason for 455 years at the start of the movie. I think they could've fleshed out her character better in that respect, but otherwise she was pretty badass. It was cool seeing big time horror director David Cronenberg cameo in the movie as a doctor trying to study Jason. I thought the futuristic space setting was a nice change of pace for a franchise that was running on fumes at the time. The Jason in this movie is awesome and a significant step up from Jason Goes to Hell, especially when he is cybernetically enhanced near the end and becomes "Uber-Jason". The kills were awesome in this movie as well, with the standout being the liquid nitrogen kill. The ending with Jason plummeting to another Earth, implying that he will start a rampage once again on a new planet is neat too. I think the critics and fans that lambast this movie into the ground are taking it way too seriously. If you are looking for some dumb fun involving Jason in space, this is one of the more fun entries in this franchise and actually my second favorite.
The space stuff is cool from a sci-fi perspective.

"Jason X" employs a derivative yet refreshing sci-fi setting and quite a bit of (occasionally self-referential) humour that ranges from the pretty good to the pretty bad via the smart-ass and the simply misplaced, and the result is hands down the most different film in a franchise of mostly near-identical entries, yet one that goes downhill and is sabotaged by the shaky acting, some janky CGI and an overblown plot centered around the same old slasher tropes and accentuated by ridiculous moments.
Much better than anyone claims it is.

Jason takes outer space? The result is the arguably the perfect sequel: the same, only different.  

In my opinion,  the success of the Friday the 13 sequels,  from around the time Jason discovered his iconic hockey mask, is that the steady drumbeat of low-stakes kills is not all that scary, or even very engaging.  It's just harmless fun.   Im sure the home video market gave it a boost.   You can watch these movies with your friends,  talk during the movies, and no one's going to miss much.

So this sequel fits right in.  It's objectively bad, but I've willingly watched it at least three times by now.

Lisa Ryder is worth mentioning as an unflappable android with a corny sense of humor and a romantic attachment to one of the crew members.   It's the most original thing happening here.

Review: 
‘Jason X' is an American slasher film directed by Jim Isaac.  It is the tenth installment in the ‘Friday the 13th' film series. Why not take the franchise into space? It seems like the most logical step after not being able to create a good film since the first one.
In the year 2010, Jason Voorhees (Kane Hodder) is captured by the United States government and held at the Crystal Lake Research Facility. Government scientist Rowan LaFontaine (Lexa Doig) decides to place Jason in frozen stasis after several failed attempts to kill him. A breach is made, and Rowan is frozen alongside Jason for 455 years. Now aboard a ship in the far future they are both regenerated, and Jason continues his killing.
This is the tenth film in this series, and it's the 21 Century. Why can we still not get good actors? That's not to say the acting was bad, it was like it is in all of these movies, cheesy but suitable for what the actors are trying to accomplish. It's sad to see Kane Hodder leave after his fourth and final appearance in this film, he is my favorite Jason by far, really bringing this character to new levels.
I know that this isn't the best movie, and it does have a lot wrong with it realism wise and with continuity. God is it entertaining though! There's so much to love. The claustrophobia of the spacecraft, the tongue in cheek humour, the nerdy aspects of the film's vision. If nothing else, you need to appreciate the boldness in Jim Isaac to do a movie like this.
Overall, this may just be a guilty pleasure of mine, I know critics hated this one even more than ‘Friday the 13th: A New Beginning' which I do not understand at all. If nothing else, this movie is so entertaining and true to the character of Jason you can forgive all the cheesy humor and unnecessary scenes that should have been cut. Watch this movie and have fun, that's what it's for.
3.5/5

The Jason Vorhees saga refuses to end, and how can it, after all Jason cannot die. Murder and mayhem of this sort quickly becomes monotonous. After a brief setup, Jason starts his rampage. One-by-one, the characters are picked off, until, at the end, a plucky heroine or manly hero dispatches him (temporarily).
